Reviews.Title: “Cool and modern”
Reviews.Author: readytogo3131
Reviews.Content: So wonderful! Beautiful, spacious and high end. We've got marble, granite, travertine surfaces. Our fridge is subzero and we could have a party in our suite, it's that spacious. Happy hour at the pool is just lovely. Now, with all of this, the best part is the staff, they are fantastic! Kind, helpful, knowledgeable ane they do their best to make us feel like we are special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: al_d555
Reviews.Content: Great location, minutes away from Duval St. Room, which was more of an 'apartment' was very clean and comfortable. Truly had all the comforts of home, including full kitchen and washer/dryer with soap. The balcony was wonderful, overlooking the pool. Each bedroom also had a balcony as well. Service was outstanding and overall I would highly recommend this place for those looking for more than a hotel...this place felt more like a time share resort. Only thing you'll need to bring is a wine opener (or get a twist off!)

Reviews.Title: “Such a cute, fun spot!”
Reviews.Author: cbernard1sc
Reviews.Content: Love the Santa Maria! Great location, block from the water. Right by Southernmost and the Waldorf Astoria property. Pool was really fun. Brett ( I think) the pool valet guy was fabulous, wanted to do everything for us. Great poolside happy hour, free sunscreen, lots of water, great service. Rooms had special treats like Dove ice cream bars in freezers, homemeade muffins, bottled water, etc. Downstairs rooms seem more spacious and may have the better floorplan. We were upstairs and had 2 smaller bedrooms (Queens?) and three balconies. Great spot for a hip hotel with friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: misspeach84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria Suites the last week of February, and absolutely loved it. We stayed in suite 9 - a one-level, two-bedroom that opened right into the patio and the pool. We were originally supposed to be in a 2-bedroom bi-level, but were upgraded to this, and was glad after reading the reviews about the bi-level suites feeling too small. It was nicely decorated, very clean, and the extras were awesome - the ice cream, the smoothies, happy hour, etc. Not paying for parking was great - I've heard that so many Key West hotels charge up to $20 per day. Derek and "Ken til Ten" were great, and helpful (and we loved the lemonade that was always available in the office!) Wolfgang was always there to welcome us when we'd come stumbling back from Duval at night, and was so friendly! Plus, so many places close their pools at a certain time - at the Santa Maria they let you use the pool at any time as long as you are quiet and respectful of other guests, which was awesome. It was nice to be able to relax in the pool after long days of Key-West-Craziness! The location was nice. It was a quiet area, but in a very walkable location. If you dont like to walk, you could always take a cab, but its definitely possible to walk to Mallory Square. I would definitely recommend the Santa Maria Suites to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningFunFamily
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the rooms, hotel complex, location and staff. For those with young kids, this place is heaven. The kitchens and washer/dryers make travelling a breeze. The staff is wonderful (see the concierge if you need advice of charters, restaurants, directions, etc, they are terrific). The small touches (dove ice cream bars each night, fresh baked muffins each morning, chocolates, etc) add up to a wonderful experience. I will also add that the pool staff is wonderful - towels are offered, lemon-water is always available, and happy hour with free drinks each night (with smoothies for the kids!) is a special touch. Be sure to visit Ambrosia (their sushi restaurant) to have a spectacular meal, or eat a bento boxed lunch by the pool one afternoon, WONDERFUL!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting, or needing”
Reviews.Author: IwannagoSA
Reviews.Content: We were only in Key West for one night and decided to stay at the Santa Maria Suites based on the reviews from tripadvisor and it's association with the Small Luxury Hotels of the World. The Santa Maria Suites was originally developed as condominiums but then turned into a hotel that still feels very much like you are in a condo complex (very Melrose Place). While our room was large in square feet with a living space, a kitchen, and half bath downstairs, the bedroom and upstairs full bath (what I consider to be the most important aspects of a hotel room) were absolutely tiny. The bed was a double size and barely built above the floor in a modern box frame. Even as a double bed, there was barely any room to walk around it. We even had to keep our suitcases in the hall as there was no room for them in the room. The bathroom had no counter space to even put a glass with a toothbrush in it much less a toiletries bag. Yes, it was clean and there are some nice amenities - ice cream bars at turn down, free smoothies by the pool - but if you are looking for a nice hotel with a comfy bed and a nice bathroom, this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahrjohnson
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak highly enough about Santa Maria Suites. We visited with another couple, and everything about our visit was fabulous! Everyone was overly helpful and nice, the suites are perfect for two couples, and the beach is just a short walk away. Happy hour by the pool is also great! I would definitely recommend Santa Maria Suites to anyone visiting Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: Ssprott
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, nice pools 1 saltwater and 1 chlorine, but there were Ants in our suite. Staff very nice and pleasant to be around.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked into neighborhood was this lovely little place.”
Reviews.Author: illinoisdad
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to find very much fault with the Santa Maria Suites. Our upstairs room was lovely, and the extra living room/kitchen gave us a lot of extra space in our suite. All of the employees were gracious. What was so different from a lot of beach towns was that this little motel was just tucked into the corner of a city block. It had a much more cozy feel as if we were in a small apartment complex. During our time there, we walked up and down Duval Street so many times that I was starting to wish that I'd rented some form of transportation. We walked all over and never felt worried. We started taking the side streets when we walked for a new view, and that was interesting. The nearby beach (a couple blocks walk) was nothing amazing, but it was ok, and we had a nice lunch there. All in all, this was a memorable stay, and the Santa Maria was an interesting change of pace from the high rise hotels we often stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, still terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Homergirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit in less than a year and I have to say SMS did not disappoint. This trip we booked a one bedroom suite (all rooms at the hotel are 2 bedroom, they just locked the second bedroom and powder room and lower the price). We were placed on the first floor which I was worried about due to what a light sleeper I am. However, this hotel is built like a vault. I did not hear anyone above us (just some very faint footsteps) and nothing from our neighbors on either side. Christy at the front was more than receptive to offer our room early which was super nice. Derek was still just as cheerful and helpful as concierge. Staff here, are....well..... not in your face making sure that your every need it attended to, it is quite like most hotels in NYC where they can't do enough to help you when you ask, however, if you just walk by, they let you be. Pros: End of quiet Duval street, which could be a con to some, but we prefer this end of things. FREE PARKING.... Ice cold AC...so refreshing...and it's central, no noisy units. Full kitchen ( bring your vino and snacks....) washer and dryer...there is something to be said for washing your clothes and packing clean clothes to go home with (you know the chore after coming back and thinking to yourself....the last thing I want to do is go back to work on Monday AND do laundry...bills....shopping...). Peaceful and upscale. The place just reeks tranquility....as soon as you walk through the gate, it's like exhaling for the first time. Plenty of pool chairs this visit, and it was booked solid...so not sure if they got more chairs from our last visit, but it was nice to see. Fresh muffins every morning (yes they are blueberry every day....who cares...) dove Ice Cream in the freezer every night...and more chocolate on the bed. Cons: I really have to nit pick here, because for the peace and quiet of this hotel, it is a 5 star in my book. However, I do always find something to improve upon......A full size coffee maker would be nice, and ditch the powder creamer (use the ones in little plastic cups instead). Internet service is totally sketchy and would frequently go out...I imagine it is the solidness of the buildings and the foliage, so this probably isn't a fair Con... however you can ask for a cord at the front desk. The light on our patio at night went on and there wasn't a switch to turn off, again, this may be an unfair Con, it's probably an insurance issue to make sure that no one trips...but it would be great to sit on the patio at night without the light blasting on you. Some of the kitchen utensils were completely unusable. Corkscrew and scissors needed to be replaced.The room could really use a "magic sponge" especially on the walls and the floors in the kitchen and bath. Would do a WORLD of difference. Minimal hassle. Overall, this is the only place I want to come to when visiting Key West. Perfect in every way. Keep it up! Already planning on coming back in December for 10 days......

Reviews.Title: “Not what you see in photos”
Reviews.Author: Zen2011_12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many places and yes, Santa Maria has a friendly staff. The photos on the web site are misleading. They need to be updated. The upstairs rooms are very small. If you have any health issues and mine is my lower back, don't take the upstairs room! I asked Christy at the front dest to be move down stairs as I saw other guest leaving. Which would have given my back a break from the stairs! She said none were avalible. For me to get around the bed room was challenging. The area to walk around is about a foot, no more than two and I am normal height and weight! The bath room is small for a couple to share. I think an update on furniture and a good spring cleaning with out the overbearing smell of cleaners is needed. Was not clean enough for me. Derrick can not help you enough at the pool side and will call and arrange anything for you! The town is an very exciting place to be and lots to do, I will enjoy the last fews days even with my back spasms giving me pain! Lesson learned for further travels.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Sgraves
Reviews.Content: Booked the 2 bedroom suite. Actually booked this because of trip advisor but was still apprehensive until we unlocked the door and took a look around. Very clean, 3 bathrooms, full kitchen with bar and 4 bar stools, washer dryer, small living room with TV and also TV's in each bedroom and small deck overlooking the pool. Derek and Daniel at the pool area were awesome and made it known that they were there to make sure we had a great time. You cannot go wrong at the Santa Maria. It is close to everything and the staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great week at Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: NewTexican
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing about the popularity and excellent reviews is that we probably wont be able to afford the new price point!!!! This is a great property with excellent accommodations and staff. It was an absolute steal at $200 a night - and I don't think we'll see those levels anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Urban high-class and Key West casual too”
Reviews.Author: dee-you08
Reviews.Content: We were there for four days in February...wish it could have been more. We booked the bi-level, 2-bedroom suite. We were greeted warmly by the gentleman at the front desk. Our suite was decorated as urban upscale chic. Spotlessly clean. It was even equipped with a washer and dryer neatly tucked away in a hall closet. The pool area is so relaxing...cool jazz playing over speakers (not loud), a heated pool, a bar with complimentary drinks and smoothies, and a staff always ready to help. Across the street is a convenience store so you can stock up the kitchen or pick up any sundries you might need. One block away is a kiosk where you can buy tickets for the trolley that stops nearby. Beds are super comfortable and each bedroom and the LR had a wide screen TV. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Overall perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Janis81
Reviews.Content: Perfect getaway! Excellent rooms, excellent pool area for sunbathing and for families too. It's also only little walk from the main party area (maybe 15-20mins), so it's nice to relax by the pool after night out. I would not rank this as a family hotel only (unless you want to party hole night, then stay at the Duval Street). It's for anybody who wants something extra for the holiday and are willing to pay for it :) We had two different rooms as we enjoyed so much, we had to spend there one extra night during our road trip and our first room was already reserved. First room was one level suite by the pool with two bedrooms and second was two level suite with two bedrooms. Both were perfect for two couples but both would work excellent for families too. Staff were very helpful and even apologized that we had to change room (when we asked for extra night). As we loved the hotel, we didn't even think about different hotel when we are going to Key West again this spring. Supermarket nearby and good parking place. Ps. Try the sushi next door - excellent! And don't even think about visiting Key West without eating in Seven Fish!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff and Location!”
Reviews.Author: julie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria Feb 13th for 10 days.We had a long 12 hour journey from the UK, and arrived about 20.00hrs. We stayed in one of the ground floor suites and we were immediately impressed with it. spacious bedrooms- each with a shower a great kitchen and even a washer and dryer ! The place was always cleaned to a high standard, and the staff were really friendly and helpful. Derek the concierge was really great! He helped us organise a couple of trips- which were brilliant, and nothing seemed too much trouble for him! The walk into Duval street only took about 15 -20 minutes and down to Mallory square about 30-40 minutes. It was a lovely relaxing 10 day break, with plenty to do and see. Fully recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ChentMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Santa Maria Suites 2/20 - 2/23. The suite we stayed at was awesome. We had the 2 level suite (2 bedrooms). The facility was very clean and all the staff members were very helpful. We stayed also at other Key West hotels during the week. And none of them measured up to Santa Maria. It is a very family friendly hotel. And I like the location where it was close to all the attractions we were looking for (e.g. Butterfly Conservatory, Hemingway house, Southern Most Point..etc). We will definitely be staying here next time when we come back. And there is definitely a next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly responsive staff/not so clean facility”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: Probably the most friendly and helpfull staff we have encountered. Floor very dusty...husbands socks black after walking on them....whole suite in need of refurbish...furniture had many dents and dings..hand print on one wall...curtain had stain....bedside rugs very worn and looked dirty...TV in living room did not work for 2 days..light burned out in bathroom...pol area very nice and Derek and Dan did a great job.....muffins delivered every night but after 3 days of blueberry muffins it would be great to have a different flavor. Great to have free smoothies and ivey cold bottled water poolside. Sofa bed had great mattress but other beds were platform beds..very low to ground and uncomfortable. Would love to stay there again if refurbished and cleaner as it is a small friendly place

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lsudocts
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Quiet. A bit of a walk but easy bike ride to most places. Rooms are designed fairly tight but quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Umper
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Suite 14. We were surprised to discover a superb suite, beautifully designed and furnished. It was perfect for us, and Derek was more than friendly and helpful. We hope to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mid century luxury.”
Reviews.Author: eliza32280
Reviews.Content: Awesome location, super clean, and very nice extras! Complimentary smoothies at the pool every day, complimentary wine during happy hour and turn down service with ice cream,chocolates and muffins. We will be back next year. Very nice rooms wtih granite countertops in kitchen with modern cabinets right out of a magazine even a wine refrigerator, and washing machine! Also, 3 decks!! Wolfgang was awesome and helpful as well as the afternoon bartender at the pool, (I can't remember his name) and free parking. The only downside is that it is not on oceanview but super close.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best place there !”
Reviews.Author: shaman514
Reviews.Content: Great location... in the earth of things without any disadvantages (if you don't mind walking). Staff is great, suites are superb.... But sometimes room service is spotty...

Reviews.Title: “4 trips to Key West in 2011”
Reviews.Author: vacationgoddess61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria suites in the summer of 2011. The accomodations were perfect. We took my children (18 and 25 years old) on this trip and they are now in love with our paradise! Everyone at the Santa Maria suites go above and beyond to make your vacation perfect. We stayed in the two bedroom and it was very roomie! My son slept on the pull out bed so he had his own space and said the bed was very comfortable. The extras they do here are great and were very much appreciated. I recommend this location highly to couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: J n
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on a place before but sitting here on this quaint poolside veranda, I had to let others know about it. The Santa Maria suites is the most delightful place I have ever stayed at. It is tucked into a quiet southwest corner of Key West. The decor is beautiful; Tavertine tiles, marble counters, crisps whites and glass accents. We had the two level one bedroom suite #25. Highly recommend this place as a romantic getaway, nudge, nudge, wink, wink!!!!! Guys will score serious brownie points booking this place!!! The free poolside smoothies, ice cream bars and chocolates are lovely perk. Derek is a great poolside host and Ken at the front desk is very helpful in suggesting things to do while you are here. I will be raving about this place for a long time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A MOST AWESOME EXPERIENCE!!”
Reviews.Author: suecork54
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful 6 days here! We were delighted with our choice and we looked long and hard. The people were so friendly and helpful, especially Derek who felt like family, helped us out with a great fishing trip and a sunset cruise with the best captains It was like something you see in the movies! The decor was outstanding and so modern and upscale. It was great having smoothies and fruit and water and sunscreen to top it off. So nice not to have to run to the store every day for the little things. The pool was clean with walk in steps and the atmosphere was so relaxing. We were so close to everything but hidden away from the crowds and the craziness. It was very relaxing and fun! Muffins and ice cream at night and plenty of space to play games and chill. Very quiet and very clean. Beds were big and comfortable. Blinds kept out the light. I would recommend this to every age group and did not see a place i would have rather stayed at. Shops and bike rentals outside your door. Walking distance to it all but away from the crazy. Would fly direct next time since you don't need a car and save the time to spend enjoying instead of the long drive from fort lauderdale, 4 hours. It was nice to see but too much to do in the keys to spend time in the car. Felt like we were on an island with the tropical plants and the lighting at night was so cool! Felt like home away from home only better.Can't wait to go back and bring more family and friends. You will not be disappointed! Restaurant had great food too.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond on an isle of gems!”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: I had the delightful pleasure to stay at the Santa Maria Suites in January of 2012 and I have to say that words can not describe my stay there. After being dropped off by my taxi, I walked into the cute lobby on the side of Ambrosia, the Japanese restaurant built into the resort, and I was greeted by a smiling face and some helpful advise. My room was not ready, for I arrived a little early, but my luggage was taken from me and was invited to sit by the pool area to wait for my room. Walking out into the pool area, you get to take in the lush tropical plants and the magically laid out pool area. With a small bar area, with complementary fruit smoothies, wine for a happy hour and towels, overlooking two pools, the view was amazing. The hotel that surrounds the pool area is like a small, upscale village. Extremely warm and inviting! After sitting and soaking up the Key West sun, I was informed that my room was ready. I was delighted to find that my bags had been moved to my room for me. How they got in there, right under my nose, I have no clue. On to the suite, what an amazing place. I wish my living room and kitchen was this nice. A nice flat screen tv with two chairs and a dvd player grace the front left side of the living room and a nice sofa with a coffee table across the room are both tastefully decorated to make the Key West lifestyle. The kitchen area is fully stocked with glasses and plates and has a full stove and dish washer. The refrigerator is built into the counter and came with bottles of water and some wonderful Dove Ice Cream bars. Those are so nice on a warm Key West day. Also, there is a wine refrigerator, which came in handy for some bottles of wine I happen to bring back to the room. Everything was clean and ready to go if I wanted to cook. The bedroom was great! Artfully done, if a lovely TV and the most comfortable mattress I have ever slept on in a hotel. I slept like a dream after a hard day of enjoying the pool area or walking along the picaresque streets of Key West. An added bonus is the nightly turn down service. Roll into your room and your bed is ready for you and a little sweet Dove chocolates await you on your pillow! How sweet! The bathroom is great, with dual shower heads and the great glass shower doors that are spotless each evening. Dual sinks in an ultra modern feel. I want this bathroom in my house. Every night when entering through the lobby, Wolfgang welcomed us "home". The staff gets to know you and makes you feel like you are home. Our concierge, Derek, worked his rear off finding out things for us to see and do. If he did not have an answer for something, he was on the phone, finding it for us. He even called a local seafood market to see if they had conk salad. Because of the pool and the service of our concierge, we spent the whole day by the pool, relaxing and soaking in the sun! I have never done that at a hotel, but everything was so warm and inviting! It is one block from the beach, so no need to drag your rental car out of the lot and has some fine dining around the block at Louis' Backyard. Santa Maria Suites is a nice place to get away from it all. It is tucked away at the southern part of the island, less touristy, more resort! I would stay here again, in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Simple Luxury in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: pyecha
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for a honeymoon in Key West! Suite 4 was beautiful. The decor had the sleek feel of Miami Beach and the place is so clean you could eat off of the floor. The perks were limitless. Skip to the next paragraph if you'd rather be surprised! Complimentary smoothies and happy hour by the pool poured by Derek (if your lucky), the most fabulous concierge I've ever encountered. Ice cream bars magically apprear in the freezer and turn down service leaves not only chocolates but muffins for your breakfast the next morning. The entire staff goes out of their way to make sure that your stay is the best it can be and the place is gorgeous. I recommend taking a day to hang by the pool to enjoy sushi from Ambrosia, the on-site sushi restaurant and let Derek pamper you! :) I wish all hotels were like this one.

Reviews.Title: “First timers in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: We researched places to stay via trip advisor, very helpful. We chose Santa Maria based on reviews, location and our overall requirements. This place was wonderful, the staff was very helpful with booking daily excursions, suggestions for nice dinners, and just making sure we experienced Key West. It's only 100 yards to the beach, 25 minute walk to Mallory Square via Duval, and walking distance to everything. If you're looking for a quiet, nice, clean, cozy place close enough to everything you've found it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on Superbowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: MGoBlueGrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on Superbowl weekend (Friday and Saturday). Here's why I would highly recommend this place in a nutshell: *Good location for walking everywhere *Great proximity to a trolley stop *Beautiful suites with two bedrooms, two bathrooms *Free ice cream bars each afternoon (left in your freezer) *Free bottled water all day from the pool area *Free smoothies from the pool area *Access to the nearby beach complimentary *Your choice of sunscreens/suntan lotion to use during your stay Now for the recap! We (my husband and I) were traveling with my inlaws. This was the perfect place for us because we each had our own space with private baths and bedrooms, and yet we shared a living area, a large kitchen with all the amenities you could possibly imagine plus kitchenware if you wanted to cook your own meal, and a couple balconies. I should also add that the bathrooms were great with very modern (the whole place is pretty modern really) fixtures and tiled showers with multiple shower heads. Fun! The only downside was we were on the second floor and it was a LOT of stairs up to our room. My MIL had a hard time with the steps--we should have asked for a ground level room. Our fault. The pool area was very secluded feeling from the rest of KW and the added bonus of free bottled water and smoothies was perfect for us and saved us having to buy it elsewhere. It was great to grab a bottle on our way out to walk Duval Street or head to the beach! The beach is nearby and you can use it for free as part of your room amenities. Otherwise it sounded like the kid was charging people $5 to set up their plastic lawn chairs. The beach was just ok, and the water really yucky looking, but we really didn't go to KW to hang at the beach all day. They also offered us our choice from a large basket of various bottles of suntan/block items. They were all opened and had been used, so I could just pick one and bring it back when we were done. I have never seen this at a hotel before and I thought it was cool. Since we had carry-ons only for the flight, we couldn't bring our big bottles from home... The staff at the hotel was international but understanding them wasn't a problem. We probably asked for three different recommendations from them and they were always very willing to help. All of the recommendations but one were spot on. This hotel is located a block over from the very southern end of Duval Street. We walked everywhere without a problem and loved that it seemed 'quieter' on our end of the island. There was also a trolley stop just across the street which was really convenient for my MIL. The Southernmost Beach Cafe was half a block away so we ate there twice (see my review) and loved that too. Overall I would highly recommend this place. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because I thought it was a little pricey for early February but that's Key West I suppose. I was glad we were able to split the cost with the inlaws!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale accommodations in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: eyw-mke
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a breeze. We stayed in a two bedroom, two bath suite and it was spotlessly clean. The pool area was open and spacious with a large free-form pool. The location near Duval Street was fantastic. In the past, we have stayed at other accommodations in Key West, but the Santa Maria blows them away. I highly recommend the Santa Maria suites!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: mstarling
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. Beautiful rooms and pool. I'd. Own. Room ifi could.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is nice smell in room”
Reviews.Author: koster25
Reviews.Content: When we checked in there was no one to help with the bags, so my lazy self had to bring in the luggage. There was a smell maybe bug spray???(suite 20) that persisted throughout our stay. Room was great. Dove chocholate & ice cream, water, muffins in the room. Pool side smoothies were great. Wine was ok. Queen beds were great. They should give you the internet pass code at checkin as I had to go done to the lobby because no one answered when i called down. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: NDG
Reviews.Content: After careful research, I chose The Santa Maria Suites. The reviews were all positive, and that's what I look for. I have to say, all the reviews were correct. The place is beautiful, clean, spacious. You have a full kitchen, I had two bedrooms and two full bathrooms upstairs, and a pullout couch and half bathroom downstairs. I have to say that Derek, the bartender at the pool, goes over and above the call of duty to make you feel welcome and comfortable. He was such a pleasure to talk to. He would fill our glasses with delicious wine, and told us to help ourselves to pita chips and dip. The smoothies are wonderful, with or without alcohol. They give you bottled water, which I think is a plus for a stay in Florida. The weather was perfect for the three days we stayed, which was Nov. 8-11. I liked the peacefulness of the place during the week. You can go as mild or wild as you want when you go on the main street filled with restaurants, bars, shops, etc. It's a fun place, and my familly can't wait to come back. Irish Kevin's was a fun bar. Mallory Square was very nice. Backyard Louie's was delicious. We went to two beaches that were walking distance from our hotel. The small beach, about a block away gave us free chairs, and there's a nice cafe there to eat. There's another public beach about 5 blocks away, a lot bigger, but you have to pay for the chairs. I would say this hotel is perfect for couples, families, singles, it's a piece of heaven, and we enjoyed every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kirklandgirl02
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Small Luxury Hotels but did not find anything luxury at all. (Usually SLH program implies correctly.) We were disappointed to quality, and were wondering how Santa Maria Suites keeps receiving rave reviews... We do not agree. Suites have stylish interior decor, but are not clean. Our two bedroom suite had very dusty bedrooms - I got allergic reaction and had to start medication. And the kitchen was awfully dirty. The kitchen cabinets were spotty with greasy fingerprints, the plates were not so clean, and among 'clean' ones were totally unwashed ones. Yikes! So I washed everything by hand before use as the dishwasher was no good. Hotel delivers muffins and small ice creams every night. Although the muffins were wrapped on plastic, as soon as the muffins were delivered, came also the brownish ant-like insects. Not so nice to have insects climbing all over your muffins, so we never ate a single one. The pool area looks nice and has a tropical vibe. Unfortunately water in pools was quite dirty, seemed brownish. Pools would need cleaning far more often. And, be aware that Santa Maria Suites has no services what one would expect of a luxury hotel. All in all, we came to conclusion that Santa Maria Suites should be called something else but a luxury hotel. It is far more like an average three star apatment hotel. -- And when compared to what you pay for it, you do not get enough for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value.......perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: funhogsinDC
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at SMS last April. Loved the suite.....had a bi-level.....two bedroom......plenty of room both upstairs and downstairs. Huge kitchen! Nice pool.....free slushys.....free ice cream bars, fruit. and muffins!! What we all loved the most was the location. We all rented bikes and road them everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Sanctuary of Seclusion & Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Jan M
Reviews.Content: I have just had a lovely relaxing holiday with my sister & brother-in-law. The hotel was spotless & very comfortable with everything we needed. The staff were all very nice, but I must compliment you on employing Derek the Concierge, his willingness to assist in booking events & resturants for us was second to none. He kept the pool area in a wonderful condition, was always kind & considerate, he has helped to make the experience an excellent one. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge of the Year!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn W
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay. Quiet and restful if that is what you want & sun if fun if you don't. The rooms were clean and comfortable but for us it was really Derek, the Concierge, who made this place 5 star. He went above and beyond to insure that our vacation was first rate. From making a great poolside smoothie to guiding us in places we wanted to go. Don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerkerhell
Reviews.Content: I usually do about 50 hotel nights a year, and I can tell you that this hotel is a new favorite of mine. The rooms are large and very nice. The service is friendly with a smile. Higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to It's Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: Just took a short family trip to Key West for the first time. My wife did a tremendous amount of research on where we should stay and landed at Santa Maria. Glad she did! Everything others have said is true and Santa Maria lived up to it's reputation. From all the major hotel rating data points it was 100%; cleanliness, service, location, size/layout of room and price/value. Some of other great point to consider would be; walking distance to Southernmost Cafe, a terrific beach side bar/restaurant that's a short walk, short walk to 90 Miles to Cuba Sign, next store neighbor to Reach Hotel and Starbucks and terrific pool area and beaches and staff with great restaurant and suggestions on where to go, eat and more. Full time concierge's. The sole areas where there's room for improvement would be in fitness area, which is not very scenic getting to and without much space or nice equipment as well as breakfast. I would prefer a real continental breakfast; perhaps served in Ambrosia or poolside with lots of food options rather than coffee and muffins in the room. All in all great place and would stay there again and recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Fabolous1751
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place in February, 2011, and it was excellent. Beautiful condo with ultra modern appliances and fixtures, great kitchen, wonderful bath. And it is centrally located to everything. Very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Alison P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid November for 2 nights and I didn't want to leave! I could literally live there! This is not a "hotel" by any means. It almost feels like an upscale condominium complex. The suites are large and come with everything you need (washer, dryer, kitchen gadgets, etc). The pool area is tropical and relaxing and offers free smoothies. They also have a great complimentary wine happy hour every day! But what really makes this resort is the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, especially Derek. He is your go-to-guy for everything Key West and has great recommendations. I can not wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best atmosphere in a hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Dlira
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May 2011. 2 adults and 2 children in a 2 bedroom suite. We just loved it! The children did not want to leave even though the hotel might be more suitable for adults. The "after sun" happy hour with Derek was just fantastic! Great atmosphere and setting! Look no further for any alternative in Key West! This is the place to be! The location is a bit off the main street, but it does not matter. Only 3 minutes with a taxi and you are in the middle of it all. Enjoy! I promise you will not regret.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to a few days in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: We have spent only 1 night at the resort, but the price vs what they offer was of great value. The room was huge, very clean, and well equiped. Staff was very friendly and of help when looking for a good restaurant in Key West. The resort is only about 1 minute away from Duval Street, but you are not bothered by any noises coming from that lively street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent condo”
Reviews.Author: ScienceHollywoodFl
Reviews.Content: JUst stayed with 5 girls for a weekend getaway.Plenty of room in a gorgeous condo. Nicer kitchen facilities than my own home. Pool is great. Smoothies served free but for $5 add some alcohol. Ice cream is delivered each night. Friendly desk help. Highly recommended.Wallking distance to most areas of interest. But quiet from the Duval craziness.I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria Suites”
Reviews.Author: Sue7961
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay with my 4 adult children. We had a ground floor suite (#8) and loved it. It was huge, two baths, two kings and 3 flatscreens. The kitchen is very well equipped. I am not going to tell you what the other reviewers told you.. I am going to tell you what to bring and what not to bring. You do not need beach towels, bottled water or fruit. They provide these things. You do not need a car. You can walk, take a taxi or other form of transportation any where you want to go on the KEY. You have your own washer and dryer so pack light. They provide you with a box of detergent for one load a day. There is an ATM across the street in the Cuban market.The beach and Duval street are close and the best things we did while there were: a kayak tour at night, A jet-ski tour and rented mopeds. Derek can arrange all these things for you. It was very helpful! He is a great guy and makes a mean smoothie which is also complimentary. I highly recommend this hotel to a family or two couples going together. I liked the lay-out of the downstairs suites better.. they seem larger and have more common space along with the kitchen and living room being in the front of the suite so that you can walk right out from the living areas to the pool. Wish we could have stayed longer but were very pleased with the hotel and the surrounding area! HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “great location friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and had a wonderful experience. My only complaint would be that the water pressure is really bad in the showers. I find this critical when you are spending time at the beach and wearing sunscreen! I wish they would do something about this...maybe just replace the shower heads. If they did it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but not ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: jared5240
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 bedroom suite for 3 days with my family. The room was beautiful and we enjoyed the pool. The rooms didn't have any good views and my children weren't satisfied with their view of the parking lot. The walk to the beach was annoying but other than the views and the walk to the beach the Santa Maria hotel is a great place

Reviews.Title: “Love it, book it!”
Reviews.Author: TalkGeorge
Reviews.Content: Lovely spot and the staff makes it near perfect! Rooms are nice, pool is relaxing, locale allows for privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dr-photog
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on the great reviews of others. The staff was very great!! Especially Derick! We plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully constructed gem”
Reviews.Author: Gedit
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice villas/suites complex perfect for a family or couples sharing one villa. It is equipment with good quality kitchen appliances needed for cooking and storing groceries if you plan on staying for longer period. in the middle of the complex there lies a beautiful clean pool with crisp water were you can spend time to relax and enjoy your vacation with your kids or companions. The staff was absolutely friendly and accommodating. While this place is on the west side of Duval street, still there are nice restaurants, wine bars, coffee shops and ice cream parlors in walking distance and other attractions at the other side of Duval street might require a taxi-bike or a car. I recommend wholeheartedly and I will go back again in the next time I am there. P.S. no breakfast service on location but because the villa contains the amenities to cook meals, I rate it 5 stars because it does offer the options to cook a great breakfast and having breakfast on the kitchen island is just great.

Reviews.Title: “I patted myself on the back...”
Reviews.Author: rphnow
Reviews.Content: For selecting this hotel as our destination. The property is spacious and up to date. This was within walking distance to everything. You even had a small beach next door if you just want an ocean breeze. The best part however is the outstanding customer service! Â We stayed a full week with a first floor pool view. If we decide to return to Key West we would choose this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway from Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the commerce and crowds on Duval but really enjoyed being able to escape it at the Santa Maria. Only a block from the famous street and we had a quiet, clean and hospitable hideaway. Very friendly staff (thanks Derek), great pool area and well run property. Will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Temello
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Santa Maria, friendly staff, good location, modern an clean rooms! The best! Would come back any time. They spoil you at the pool during happy hour wth wine and delicious snacks. Kitchen in the suites are well equipped, modern and stylish. Take the advice and rent a bike, the nest way to get along in the city. The little beach nearby is nice, Fletcher looks well after you. Restaurant facilities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Adri0809
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect. It was a girls weekend for us, but I can see how it could work well for couples and families. The property is modern and comfortable. The 2 bedroom accommodations are spacious and include a full kitchen. It is perfectly clean and the beds a super comfy. Reserve without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Forget all other hotels in Key West. Go to this place !!”
Reviews.Author: robtk
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotel/resort experiences I've had ! And I've traveled quite a bit... We didn't book the hotel in advance, since we were not expected to end up in Key West. After a quick check on TripAdvisor, we decided to check out SMS. We were welcomed by Ken, and we were sold after 10 seconds: he was so enthusiastic that we had to stay here. He did show us our room before we decided and that closed the deal :-) SMS is a fairly small property, around the corner of Duval Street. The Duval Street action is a 10-15 minute walk: very convenient! The room we had (a 2 bedroom suite, with one bedroom and bathroom closed) was amazing. Very nice bed and bedroom, luxurious bathroom (with a shower for 2 people), a kitchen I wish I have at home (it even had a wine cooler/fridge), and a small terrace. The room/suite was clean and fresh and could have worked as an apartment (which makes sense, since that was the original destination of SMS). The pools were 15 steps away from our door. They are small but nice. And the pool comes with towels, sunblock, smoothies as many as you want, and in the afternoon wine and snacks. It doesn't get a lot better! And a special note about the staff: they are some of the best we've met. Friendly, helpful, always available if you have any questions and just plain fun. If we go back to Key West, we won't even think about another property. SMS is way too good to go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience !!”
Reviews.Author: rmacyn
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Nice staff. Very clean. Close to Duval street. Free happy hour wine. All necessities covered.

Reviews.Title: “Another great review”
Reviews.Author: julie1217
Reviews.Content: All the great reviews are spot on. I had a wonderful stay here with my husband, 3 year old son and 7 month old daughter. The rooms were clean and modern and the staff is incredibly nice. I think they were the nicest staff I have ever met. They were so helpful and friendly. All the extras are a good touch such as the smoothies, dove bars and muffin. It's close to restaurants and shops but far enough from the heavy bar scene that it's quiet. It also helps that the walls are concrete so you don't even hear your neighbors which was a good thing cause our baby did not sleep too well. The only downfall, a minor one if there is one, is the weak wifi signal in your room. I can't wait to go back and stay here again. It was a good choice for our little family but I wouldn't mind going back with just my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended property in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Judy M
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a good location. It was a bit of a walk to the heart of the actio on Duval, but not too bad. Parking spots in the hotel's lot were always readily available - and much appreciated. Very close walk to the Sounthernmost Point and about 6 blocks from the Hemingway House. Our one-bedroom suite was very nice, but we were surprised by all of the stairs. We were on the second floor so there was a set of stairs to get to the suuite. Once inside the suite, we discovered that it was on two levels, with the bedroom/bathroom a flight of stairs up from the kitchen/livingroom/powder room - a bit of an inconvenience. The kitchen was very large, beautiful and well-equipped. We enjoyed the mini-Dove bars that were placed in the freezer every evening, as well as the daily muffin delivery and bottled water. The livingroom had a comfortable couch, two chairs and a very large flat screen TV (maybe 52"). The upper level was not quite as comfortable. The bedroom was rather small, without very much room to maneuver. The bathroom had nice decor, but there was virtually no couner space. Towels were great - large and thick. The hotel's pool area and landscaping were lovely. Free smoothies and fresh fruit all day long and free wine and snacks at happy hour by the pool were a really nice benefit. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel and would certainly stay there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “#1 for a reason”
Reviews.Author: jo00
Reviews.Content: I booked the room at SMS based on all of the great reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. We stayed in a great room with a large kitchen/living area and a separate bedroom. Decor was very modern and clean. The room had a washer/dryer and icemaker as well. The entire place was well maintained and well landscaped. Great pool. By far the high point was the staff. Very friendly and accommodating, Derek who worked double duty as poolside bartender and concierge was very helpful, and booked a great spa excursion for my wife. We didn't utilize the beach access, but we walked by and it looked nice. Location was good, a block of the south end of Duval, close to southernmost point and butterfly conservatory. 25 minute walk to Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at Santa Maria Suites”
Reviews.Author: Jpotter68
Reviews.Content: This is the third time staying at Santa Maria, and it still is a great time. The front office is always very helpful, and the Concierge, Derek, is great! He actually helped find a planner for a future wedding on Key West. The pool is top notch, and the rooms are spic n' span clean, and very modern. The only concern I have with the room, is the bedding. It is a platform bed, which makes is pretty low getting in and out of, so I wouldnt suggest it for older people that might have a hard time getting in and out of bed. The location is great, being one block from Duval st. There is no beach connected, but there is beach access, one block away. There is also a local store for minor needs, and a bike/scooter rental across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Must return!”
Reviews.Author: KEH H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend with my three college buddies - great place for a "girls weekend." The Santa Maria Suites were incredible - far enough away but close enough to the craziness on Duval...the facility is gorgeous...and I cannot say enough about the staff. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else if I have a choice.”
Reviews.Author: McLoaf
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria Suites is the only hotel I've experienced in Key West, but my wife and I have no need to look further - we've found our "island home," and we do plan on returning at the earliest opportunity. First, the property is beautiful and well-maintained. The central pools and gardens make the place lush and inviting, and relaxing music plays at just the right volume, so hanging out by the pool is very relaxing. Our suite came with a well-equipped kitchen with brand new appliances, and had we not enjoyed so many restaurants we would have made better use of it. If you want to vacation on a budget, you could easily cook all your meals in your suite. Housekeeping kept our suite very clean, turned down the bed (with chocolates) and provided muffins for breakfast each day. The hotel is located just a block from Duval Street (the "main drag,") but is on the quiet side of the island. If you want to whoop it up, all the bars are within a mile's walk (though I recommend a scooter,) but when the night's over, you can go back to your nice quiet room. In some hotels closer to the action, there's no such thing as quiet. Now about the staff... I have never had so many consistently friendly, knowledgeable, helpful people working to make my vacation so enjoyable. We were greeted by Ken, who gave us the rundown on the hotel and the island, and continued to take care of our needs for the rest of the week, from renting a scooter, to booking restaurant reservations, to getting our cab for our trip home. Derek, the poolside concierge, was my MVP. Being a resident of Key West, he knew the place like the back of his hand and his opinions of various places began to mirror my own, so I trusted his advice implicitly. He booked a great snorkeling trip for us, lent us towels and sunscreen to take to the beach, booked dinners for us, provided us with bottled water and snacks... He treated us like guests in his home. I can't say enough good things about Derek. They are really doing things right at Santa Maria Suites. And did I mention their rates? They're described as a 4 star hotel, but their off-season rates are very reasonable, and certainly better than some less-desirable hotels. You won't regret staying at Santa Maria Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BeachloverNewLenox
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week of October for three nites. Loved this place! Clean and the staff is sooo friendly. We had a two bedroom suite with another couple. Plenty of room in the suite, but wish we had a bigger balcony. Next time we stay here I think I will request a ground level off of pool. Those had a nice big area to sit with another couple and have drinks. Not much of a bar by the pool. But that was just fine cause we brought our own beer and cocktails with us. If you don't bring your own drinks there was a little mini mart store right across the street. Takes about 20 minutes to walk to the end of Duvall Street. That was a blast! Lots to see and lots of places to eat. Checkout Louie's Backyard. OMG the best food in Key West!!! The atmosphere was absolutely beautiful. Alittle pricey but well worth it. Just one block from Santa Maria Suites. We will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Suite”
Reviews.Author: tonyjalicea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights for our honeymoon (Oct. 9-15). To say we enjoyed our stay would be the understatement of the year! The great service started before I even booked our stay. I had been doing research and saw that this place was #1 on Trip Advisor. I called and spoke to Ken and he answered all my questions and gave me some recommendations. I ended up booking online and getting the Romance package which saved us some money and got us in the upgraded 2 bedroom suite! When we arrived, we were greeted by Ken. He welcomed us and gave us our room. I confirmed that it was a pool view because that's what all the other reviewers recommended. It was but it was a little off and didn't have a direct view. He told us to check out the suite and come back and tell him what we thought. Meanwhile he was checking to see what was available. The suite was gorgeous but we didn't love the view and the rooms were on the 3rd floor. We told him this and he managed to get us upgraded to Suite 17. IMO, this is the best suite in the hotel. It had a perfect view of the pool, but behind enough foliage to not have everyone in the pool able to see directly into our room. My wife and I spent the first 5 minutes with our jaws wide open! The room was incredible. From the fully stocked (pots/pans/silverware) kitchen, dish washer, washer & dryer and spacious living room...we were already blown away. Our bedroom was beautiful, the bed was like sleeping on a cloud and the master bath with its twin basin sinks and the twin showers were absolutely amazing! We honestly could have stayed holed up in the room all week but when we decided to head down to the pool, it was another taste of heaven. The pool is beautiful and has a cool fountain that is fun to stand under. Drinks by Derek were a treat. Free waters and smoothies were great and Derek's cocktails were fantastic (and strong!). Yay! Our stay exceeded our expectations in every way and I couldn't have been more pleased with coming here for our honeymoon! We'll definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with super nice staff”
Reviews.Author: st11al
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice place, only 35 rooms so reserve early. Easy close parking. Kitchen fully equipped with everything needed and all top quality. Ours was a 2 level with kitchen, restroom, laundry, & living room downstairs with the bedroom & bathroom up. Very clean like new condition. Everyone here is super nice & helpful, asked one of the cleaning guys for a couple of extra hangers & coffee packets and within minutes he was back with 6 of each. The check in desk was interested and ready to assist with any needs as was Derek at the pool bar who is also in charge of anything that you might need. All areas clean and well maintained.The grounds and pool area are beautiful. It seemed that the pool was available at any time, as I saw people swiming & talking to staff at 2am. While I found the kitchen & living room to be roomy the bedroom & bathrooms are tight. I dont think a king bed would have fit in our bedroom. The bed was mounted very low to the floor and was a bit of a task for a 6'1" 260 pound guy to get out of. If you are a big guy get a room with a king bed, we were a bit crowded in the queen bed in this room. The little touches as others have mentioned are nice, muffins, ice cream, chocolate left nightly, free smoothies at the pool bar etc. I found wifi signal to be strong & fast if that matters to you. I will certainly recommend & probably will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Capma
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rent a bike or scooter to get around. These are condos used as hotel so they have an equipped kitchen w/stacked washer and dryer - you can pack less since you can wash a load of clothes. If you want to save some money I would buy a few groceries especially breakfast or brunch food-they give you muffins, water each night with Dove chocolate and mini frozen bars. By the pool you get complimentary water and smoothies. We had 2 bedrm suite but the area around the beds is narrow and the shower is narrow. If you are big or large be ready to struggle a little not to hit the wall or hit your leg. Biggest down side is limited wifi - could not get service in the room and only get a weak signal on patio. Strong signal by pool but not where I want to do work. Derek is great and helpful on places to eat and where to go. Ambrosia sushi restaurant is on site and very, very good! I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but look out for those hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: All in all a very enjoable stay. Couldn't find fault with the accomodation and the pool outside the appartment was very relaxing. Derek the poolside concierge was a gentleman and very helpful. I prefer the freedom self catering accomodation offers and this had exactly that but with the luxury feel a hotel offers. They loose the one star due to the finances. Intially i was charged too much on the credit card (so make sure you check when you return home) and in resolving that problem some hidden costs that were in the small print suddently became apparent. When i get quoted a cost, i expect it to be that cost. Shame as it tainted an otherwise very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment”
Reviews.Author: melwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite that you reach by walking up some stairs to the front door of the apartment. The apartments overlook the pool from a balcony. There is considerable vegetation around the pool which gives it a tropical feel and maintains some privacy from the balconies of the hotel which are of transparent glass. The bedrooms face the street on the other side, but as this is the quiet part of Key West that isnâ€™t a problem. Kitchen/living area is spacious and comfortable. The main bathroom is large, but the second bathroom is quite small. The overall quality of finish is very good and we enjoyed having a home form home for a week. Itâ€™s a long walk (20 plus minutes) to the main action area at the other end of Duval Street. There are plenty of shops and eateries before that. If I have a negaitive, its the distance from the car-park to the apartment for bringing our suitcases and food shopping, which took 3 or 4 trips. Staff both friendly and efficient. TIP Stop at Key Largo at the supermarket to buy provisions for your stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome rooms, service alright”
Reviews.Author: tariQ87
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Santa Maria and were overwhelmed by the modern look of the rooms / apartment! everything looked stylish and clean! the receptionists were helpful and friendly, but asking as about certain tours like snorkeling trips and ket skiing, we later on found out that bookin on the streets was a lot more priceworthy... despite and not knowing right on from the start, we did book a snorkeling trip that was recommended to us by one of the receptionist. that trip was bad, but we were offered a late check out for the day of departure. since we liked the hotel so much though, we got a discout for staying another night, what was nice! all in all, I'd recommend the hotel, but since it's a "gay-friendly" hotel, guests are supposed to be tolerant when hanging out a lo at the pool...

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenating”
Reviews.Author: Carolin L
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a quiet haven amongst beautifully manicured grounds, a block from Duval Street and all its activity. Our one bedroom suite was on one level (the better of the two options) with a large balcony overlooking the pool. The bathroom was large and luxurious and the kitchen VERY well equipped - and included a wine fridge in addition to the main fridge. The parking and internet are free, as are the fruit smoothies, popsicles, ice cream bars, breakfast muffins and coffee and the happy hour. Talk about value. The staff are friendly and proud to work at this lovely hotel, Derek was especially helpful and accomodating, recommending numerous great restaurants and steering us clear of the cheesy tourist traps. The rooms are incredibly quiet and well designed. The only comment is the fitness center could use more equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Best gateaway”
Reviews.Author: minsh
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, modern, love the use of space, each room has everything you need, quiet, great service.......

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: acon2012
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria suites lives up to it's great reviews. Each unit is like a small condo, and the staff really is as nice and useful as adverised. I would stay there again in a heartbeat, but a few things to note: 1) the 1-bedroom unit we stayed in was on two floors, with the living room and kitchen on the first floor, and the bedroom up a steep flight of stairs. Didn't bother me, but it was a surprise and would have been a big problem for anyone who had trouble with stairs 2) The bathroom is nice but small compared to a typical hotel suite's bathroom. My girlfriend complained that the sink area wasn't big enough for her make-up, etc. 3) The hotel is not on the beach, and the nearby beach that guests have access to isn't very good. The hotel staff recommended we visit the beach in the nearby national park, which wad great advice but also pretty expensive after the cab ride, park fee, and chair rental. Overall it was a great visit and I'll likely stay there again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute trip to Key West. We chose the Santa Maria Suites because of reviews that we had read on trip advisor. They were all right!! It is a beautiful property and the staff is wonderful. What we liked most about it was the location and the fact that it isn't a huge property. So you get lots of individual attention. Whenever we asked what we should do or where we should eat every suggestion was perfect. We had the best time ever and will be returning for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “West Palm Beach”
Reviews.Author: SueWPB
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria Suites was fabulous and Derek was so professional and the service he provided was second to none. The rooms are very clean and spacious, the location is wonderful. They have music on Saturday poolside and the musician on 9/25/11 was top notch. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Dreams do come true...”
Reviews.Author: LoneRanger701
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sanata Maria Suit. for 6 nights and had a truly fantasic time. I checked out Tripadvisor when originally looking for a good place to stay in Key West and it really came up trumps with this gem of a place. I loved my one bedroom appartment, which had absolutely everything you'd ever want and more. It was clean, stylish and always well maintained every day by the great room service personel. What really made my stay so relaxing and enjoyable was the wonderful Derek, the concierge. His advice on restaurants and excursions to take are priceless and will not disappoint. Loved, loved, loved the pool side smoothies which were refereshing and never ending. Especially enjoyable were the late afternoon complimentary pool side wine and snacks, which was a lovely way to set you up for the night ahead. Location was great and walking distance to all the main attractions of Key West. The only very minor gripe l had, which has already been mentioned by others, is the rather poor/spuradic internet connections within the appartment. Other than that, l had a fantastic time at the Santa Maria. This place is a dream...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: morrobainn
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the smoothies were amazing and a real treat to keep you refreshed. The rooms are fantastic; modern, clean and with everything you could wish for. The location is great, just a short walk to everything you would want to see. I could not recommend this more for a chilled out experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, amazing staff, and beautiful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: roekatie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria for 6 days in September for our honeymoon. I have never been to a hotel with such a great staff and so many little perks. Christy and Derek were great help with pointing us to fabulous restaurants, making tour reservations for us, and making sure we were all taken care of with room amenities and towels, drinks, and suntan lotion at the pool. We cannot say enough about their service. the pool was beautiful and very clean. Derek does an amazing job of making sure you always have towels, cold water, and basically anything else you need. The rooms were newly remodeled with new appliances. They were very clean, and beautiful. The kitchen had everything we needed for quick breakfast and lunches and even dinner if you want to cook and the maids came everyday and made up the room for us. We were there during the off season, but there were plenty of people there without it feeling too crowded. It was perfect for us and our honeymoon. If we return to Key West, we wouldn't stay anywhere but the Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Suite, Great Staff, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyDerbygirl
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was absolutely perfect for our family trip to Key West. We were away from the wildest aspects of Duvall Street but well within walking distance for the times we wanted to indulge! We enjoyed the dove chocolate bars, chocolates and muffins left in our suite each night and enjoyed the free wine and hummus at happy hour each afternoon. The staff had great recommendations and made us feel like we "belonged". The only thing we didn't love was the Japanese restaurant at the hotel, we found it just average but might have hit on an off night since others seemed to have a better experience! Go to Key West and enjoy this fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SallyChesterfield
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed 3 nights at The Santa Maria Suites during a tour of the area. The Santa maria suite lives upto its No 1 staus on Tripadvisor. The Loacation was near all the action in Duvall Street which was a pleaseant walk to the top of the street where the main action was. The Room were an apartment style with a kitchen , Lounge , bedroom and 2 bathroms, The rroms were clean, well maintained and modern. The pool service was great and Derek deserves a mention, nothing was too much trouble he was a asset to the hotel, If there was one issue it was I could not get on the FREE WiFi as my room was not overlooking the pool area, around the pool there was not a problem. I looked at a number of properies when I chose to visit Key West and definatly made the right one. We would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent -- can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: USArmyCW3
Reviews.Content: we went for four days and it wasn't long enough. traveled with two other couples. we all stayed at different hotels. all near duvall. all were excellent, but santa maria is our favorite. it's the hotel staff that made the difference. they gave good advice on where to go and places to eat. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: DIANE W
Reviews.Content: Just read the previous review from Matt, having stayed at SMS in August and had a wonderful stay in a 2 bi pool view bedroom suite, can understand if reporting cleanliness issues. However, wireless connection issues, going away on vacation if wireless is your absolute priority and is essential then it would be wise to have a prepaid dongle (USB stick) with you at all times as no one can guarantee wireless, especially when you can get interferance from the weather. We had a fantastic time Suite beautiful, as it is a Hotel cannot be in pristine, brand new never been used before condition, we loved our suite, and views, Hotel staff and Manager excellant, smoothies, ice cream, water and muffins, what a treat, pull out sofa in lounge, most comfortable ever, location brilliant and great parking, can't fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant 4-star experience”
Reviews.Author: Matt_UKTX
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Santa Maria Suites for a long weekend break over Labor Day weekend. Overall, we were happy with the hotel and enjoyed our stay. I had e-mailed the hotel ahead of time to let them know we would be arriving late at night (driving down from Miami Airport in a rental car). I also requested a suite with a king bed and pool view. We arrived at the hotel at 3am, and were greeted by Wolfgang. He was superb, very friendly, funny and chipper - especially seeing as it was 3am. To my pleasant surprise, our requests had been granted and we were assigned to Suite #6. Wolfie was a super nice guy, and actually made our experience at the hotel even better than it otherwise would have been. He also recommended a nice restaurant for dinner, and told us about the free amenities that the hotel offers included with the $15 per day resort fee. Our suite was very pleasant overall and nicely furnished, although there are a few things that could be improved - such as loose faucets in the shower, a small stain on the bedding, a scratched up kitchen cabinet (where the trash was stored), a dirty bathroom, and lack of towels for half a day. Also, our internet access was very spotty in Unit 6. This can easily be addressed by adding more wireless routers. Finally, I had to use a hardwire connection, but even that failed after a day. The staff didn't seem to know much about the internet service and offered to call a technician the following day, but we were already checking out. Internet Access is critical for me when traveling, so I think this should be addressed and tested in every unit ASAP. The pools were nice, but a couple of the paving slabs are loose around the pool too. This should be addressed also. Note, these were very minor gripes and overall I liked the hotel and would go back. Pros and cons were as follows: PROS: - Good location - Modern and clean - Friendly staff - Many perks included with the resort fee CONS: - Some minor items need attention - Expensive over Labor Day (but where isn't!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: KellyQuick
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Santa Maria. I can't find anything negative so say about the entire experience. The room was lovely and spacious, providing all amenities. The pool area is simply gorgeous! Derek went out of his way to be friendly and make us feel welcome. While we enjoyed the pool he brought us fresh sliced oranges, water, smoothies, etc and always had a smile and nice word to say. All the staff was exceptional and I will definitely recommend Santa Maria to people traveling to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelcritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight trip to Key West-after staying here, we wished we could have stayed longer. The pictures on the website don't do the place justice. The suites are above and beyond the usual tiny kitchen and small bedrooms. The kitchens are huge, the bedrooms spacious and the design and finishes are top notch. The suites all surround the central pool area. The attached restaurant had excellent sushi. Although a bit removed from the main attractions of Key West, the walk is not far and perhaps the quiet afforded by its location is its best attibute.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Vacation”
Reviews.Author: swan056
Reviews.Content: Stayed at SMS 23-25 Aug for my daughter's 19 Birthday, on arrival met with friendly, helpful staff, room exactly as expected, beautiful bi pool view, state of the art kitchen with all appliances, great bathrooms, very comfortable pull out sofa bed, good quality, 2 bedrooms lovely, smoothies from Dereck just exquisite, wanted for nothing, exactly in the right place, just by Duval Street and lovely beach, after 7 hour drive from St Pete's was so relaxing, would not hesitate to go back to this Hotel again and again. thank you so much for a wonderful stay ..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dana K
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria Suites was a great place to stay for a long weekend in Key West. The special touches were noticed from the cleanliness, the Dove bars in the freezer every night, the blueberry muffins for the morning, the free Tide, the smoothies and water at the pool....the list goes on and on. Dereck, the pool concierge was amazing. He made our dinner reservations and recreational reservations and had great suggestions. The people at the front desk were not so helpful so make sure you talk to Dereck.

Reviews.Title: “Too much fun!”
Reviews.Author: JulesMish
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria Suites was wonderful! It was in the perfect location for us and the staff was out of this world! When back in Key West we won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a GEM in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: IamaPittsburgher
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED the Sana Maria! The location is outstanding (on the quiet end of the island) and there is nothing not to love about this place. My family and I spent four days at the Santa Maria last week and loved every minute of our stay. The staff were all so pleasant and helpful. Derek the conceierge was ever present and always so helpful. Kudos also to Ken, Summer and Christine who were equally as pleasant and helpful. The staff were always willing to help identify restaurants, activities, etc. Great team. The rooms were lovely. We had a two bedroom suite on the ground level. The resort is quite, even with our kids (and about 10 others around the pool). Our room came with a fully equipped kitchen, which was great for avoiding the high cost of breakfast out. Large room with plenty of space and amenities for everyone. In room laundry was perfect. The hotel really does a nice job with the little extra touches. There is water and fruit smoothies available at no cost all day at the pool. Towels are available to take off resort for your activities, fresh muffins every day. As if the rooms and facilities weren't enough, the on site Japanese restaurant, Ambrosia, was excellent. We had a very enjoyable and high quality Japanese meal. We've stayed at several high end resorts over the years and I would put the Santa Maria's service and "extras" right up there with the bigger names. Very nice resort that we HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more”
Reviews.Author: BreHumphries
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in my share of five star resorts, and I can honestly say the Santa Maria provided one of my best travel experiences to date. The suites were originally designed to accommodate full-time residents, and include top-of-the-line appliances and modern design. All suites are situated around the pool and Tiki Bar, which serves up complimentary smoothies all day long, and complimentary house wine and snacks (pita chips and hummus) during Happy Hour, which starts at 4 p.m. Guests can also help themselves to sunscreen and bottled waters at the Tiki Bar. (Note: There is a nominal fee for the Tiki Bar on your bill when you check out, but we thought it was completely worth it). Guests also receive as unlimited complimentary muffins (blueberry or banana) for breakfast, as well as unlimited Dove chocolates and mini Dove ice cream bars. Though not on the beach, Santa Maria guests have access to the beach (and complimentary beach chairs) at Southernmost Inn, located a block away. There's a great casual beach bar here for lunch, and complimentary Popsicles and frozen strawberries passed around by the beach attendant in the afternoon. (One caveat: the ocean isn't great for swimming here, but I don't think it's much better at the public beaches.) Santa Maria is also home to Ambrosia, a fantastic sushi restaurant, and is located within walking distance of Louie's Backyard, possibly my favorite restaurant on Key West, with a porch overlooking the ocean. Santa Maria is also walking distance to quiet side of Duvall Street, though I suggest taking a taxi to get to Sunset Pier and any of the bars - this was actually a plus for us, as my husband and I were traveling with his parents and not really interested in the crazy, late-night scene. If I ever go back to Key West, I will most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: UKMarkB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria for 6 nights in July, on the recommendation of a colleague and the positive reviews in Tripadvisor. Our party consisted of my wife, myself and our 2 teenage kids, so the 2 room suite was the clincher for us. The suites are modern, spacious and fully specced, and the full-size kitchen gave us dining options after eating out for all of the previous week (in Orlando and Fort Lauderdale). The location is fantastic; 200 yards from the end of Duval and 200 yards from the ocean. Although the beach nearest the hotel is not that great. We took Derek's advice and went to Higgs Beach, only half a mile away, crystal, shallow waters and with a great Italian restaurant/bar. Derek, Ken and Summer are the stars of this place. Nothing is a problem and they really seem to enjoy their jobs. they booked us on a really great snorkel trip with Echo Catamarans. The pools were small but never crowded and there were always plenty of loungers. Only one or two small negatives: Maids were pushy and a little bit rude. Also, we stayed in room 18, which was furthest from the pool area. This was good in that we had a view across town from our balcony but bad because the wi-fi didn't work here. When we mentioned it we were told that "oh yeah, it doesn't always reach out there". Only minor but hey, we paid the same as the other rooms. Overall a great choice for a family stay in fantastic Key West.
