Reviews.Content: Santa Maria Suites is an oasis located in the nicest part of Key West. From the outside it doesn't compare architecturally with its neighbour, Southernmost on the Beach, but once inside everything from the beautifully landscaped pool to the decor of the suites was first class. On most days we ventured no further than the pool area and enjoyed the shade of the coconut palms and the hospitality of the excellent staff. The suites were furnished in an effective minimalist style and upstairs in our split level two bedroomed suite there was plenty of space for two adults and two teenagers. The only minor complaint was the lack of an eating area as we preferred to avoid the overpriced restaurants of Key West and cater for ourselves. We did eat in the good Ambrosia restaurant at lunchtime as prices were half those of the dinner menu. Key West itself was certainly eclectic and not quite as expected. However, the experience of the Santa Maria Suites was so good we would make the long trek down US1 again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel near Duval Street, hidden GEM!”
Reviews.Author: blitzed100
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel situated not too far from Duval street happenings and the beach. Even though it is not a beach front property, it is one of the best places to stay in Key West. Key West is not really known for it's beaches anyway, all the sand is imported from the Bahamas. The complex is quite small- 35 units with onsite free parking. There are 2 pools - sodium based, different than salt water and chlorine pools. The staff is friendly, Ken is usually there during the day as well as Derek. During the night, wolfgang is there for issues/questions. Property is modern, art deco style- similar to Miami Beach hotels. They have a happy hour from 4-5:30 with wines for free. There is also an onsite sushi restaurant, Ambrocia. We highly recommend this place.... Wifi free Bottled water in room Ice cream refreshed daily in room

Reviews.Title: “It's the best..don't look anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: mderaba
Reviews.Content: I offer yet another glowing review of the Santa Maria Suites after our family of four stayed here in early July. This is a well-managed boutique hotel in a great location, only a block from the beach and the non-busy end of Duval Street. The pool area is lovely, and the suites are absolutely gorgeous with all the amenities and then some. You could easily settle in here for a week and cook terrific meals in the well-equipped kitchen with all the ultra-modern appliances. It is very handy to have a washer and dryer in the unit as well. The staff is very service-minded and accommodating. The beds are comfy, and even the sleeper sofa is fine. You can tell the owner pays attention to details here. There are just 35 units so it is a cozy atmosphere. The complimentary muffins, Dove ice cream bars, smoothies and wine by the pool are fantastic! We loved this place and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is nice”
Reviews.Author: helloKYC
Reviews.Content: We had a good time staying at this hotel. The most important thing for me is cleaniness and this hotel is clean. Rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: wpb7772
Reviews.Content: The many great reviews speak for themselves. We had a great time at the Santa Maria. Ken and Wolfgang took great care of us. I would highly recommend and will never stay anywhere else when in Key West. Close to the beach and to Duval, yet far enough away to get away and relax if you want to. The small grocery store across the street had an amazing cuban sandwich and Louie's Backyard was a short block away. Food is amazing. Thanks again for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “This place made a great vacation even better”
Reviews.Author: LLJay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Key West today. We were 2 couples and found this place on Trip Advisor. We got a 2 bedrooms unit (each bedroom with a king bed, flat screen TV and private bathroom, one with a private balcony), 2 and a half bath unit with a full, very modern kitchen and living room (with a large flat screen TV and entertainment receiver) as well as wifi and wired network access and private balcony off the living room and another off the kitchen. The nightly turndown service with chocolates on the pillows and mini-Dove bars in the freezer are a very nice touch. Santa Maria Suites is located at the end of Simonton St, one property from the beach and one street over from Duval St. The Reach Resort is next door â€“ on the beach. They have an agreement with another hotel a block away to use that hotelâ€™s beach, but, in truth, you can just walk from Santa Maria Suites right onto the Reachâ€™s property and go to that beach. This resort is about 2 blocks from the marker for the Southernmost Point, putting it on the opposite end of Duval St from Mallory Square. This is the quieter end of town â€“ lots to do but quieter at night. Last time we were in Key West, we stayed at the Pier House (on Mallory Square) â€“ very nice but far from intimate due to the crowds. If youâ€™re not familiar with Key West and Duval St, itâ€™s about 1 Â½ miles from one end of Duval to the other, a very easy walk filled with literally hundreds of restaurants and shops along the way. The rooms all encircle 2 pools, making the resort very private. I must specifically mention Derek, who was the combination concierge / pool attendant. He helped us with suggestions for activities (we rented motor scooters as well as took a jet ski tour of the island), restaurants and sites to see. He also provided us with the complimentary smoothies and fresh fruit (all day) and complimentary drinks and snacks (happy hour). We met folks staying at Santa Maria Suites from all over the world. The focal point of the resort is the pool, and we got to know many of them while lounging by the pool or wading in it. The price is great. For all of the amenities described, it ran us about $350 / day (total â€“ not per couple), far less than 2 rooms at a â€œregularâ€� hotel, with value worth far more. There is no question that, upon our return to Key West in the future, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious 2 bedroom for same price as 2 mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: Daugman
Reviews.Content: We are originally from Miami, and know the Keys. 2 parents, our kid, plus mother in law wanted to visit Key West. Needing 2 rooms (cuz of mother in law, don't want to have 4 in one room), we found Santa Maria. Our price was about $375 pre tax, which is about the same as 2 hampton suites or whatever Even better-- the free smoothy, the pool, the wonderful desk people....added to visit. Room is exceptional--even had washer and dryer. Location is 1 blok from beach (private, but this hotel has prviileges there :). The core of downtown is about 1 mile away. We saw a lot of people walking, but we spent the $5 to park up in town. I think the Service, and Room quality are what made this place great.

Reviews.Title: “#1 place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: droopster50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Santa Maria Suites the 2nd week of June for 4 days and the only bad thing about it was leaving. Check in was fast and easy, and we were upgraded to a pool level suite by Steve and Nordi. These 2 guys work very hard to make sure you have everything you need, and it seems like they never leave the property. Derek bartends by the pool, playing his own arrangment of very good music,making free smoothies ( he puts your favorite mixer in for a small price) and will also suggest and make reservations for dining. Prime 951 rocks by the way, best beef filet in th Keys! The maids are always doing a great job leaving your suite spotless and if this was not enough, they give you a free happy hour poolside 4:00 to 5:30. Going back ASAP. Thanks everyone at Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Yellowman15
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Santa Maria for just under a week and loved our stay. The staff is great. Rooms are nice (ours had a kitchen), Lane made sure everything was to our liking and for the price, this place was a great value. You can't beat happy hour with free wine plus all day they make you free smoothies by the pool. You're a short walk to the beach and one block over from Duval Street. Overall a great place to stay. We'll do it again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: BostonGrl_10
Reviews.Content: We went on a girls trip and had a fabulous time at the Santa Maria. The suite was awesome! Very clean and neat. We loved the free bottled water, ice cream, muffins, chocolates, and smoothies. Happy hour at the pool was great. The cleaning service and turn down service was wonderful. We simply asked for more ice cream and water and were handed all that we wanted. The staff was helpful and friendly. Kenneth at the front desk was fantastic. And I didn't catch her name, but there was another woman who was extremely helpful. We've been to Key West before and all agreed we would stay here on any return trips. The only downside was the beds were not that comfortable. We found this to be a minor issue as everything else was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “First Class is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: creazyara
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is truly a gem among Key West hotels. Large suites in quiet location. Walking distance to all city attractions and beach membership at Duval Beach. It's staff is also frist grade: everyone from Jacek at the desk to Derek at the pool made me feel special from the moment I walked in. Be back first chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice sun and beach place”
Reviews.Author: WeekendSeekers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our honeymoon. Very nice suite only hotel close to the beach and the "old town" of Key West. Duval Street is just 5 minutes away. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our suite was nice but just next to the hotel The Reach, which made the atmosphere a little cramped. Kitchen was very nice an fully equipped although we did not need it. The suite itself had enough space in total as it stretched over two floors, but both the bedroom and the bathroom were a bit small. The hotel has very few amenities (fitness room too small and hardly used) but tries to make up for it by having a lot of things complementary like free smoothies and water at the bar on the pol, chairs at the beach etc.. The pool itself is not too big, but very nicely settled in a nice garden. Wi-Fi is good and free. Overall I think the hotel is quite expensive for what it offers, but it is definitely very nice for a relaxed pool / beach experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hate to be repetitive but it's simply the best”
Reviews.Author: 2skis
Reviews.Content: We booked here based on reviews on Tripadvisor and they were right on. I don't want to repeat all the other things that others have said but yes, they are all true. I just want to say hi to Ken at the desk for all the great recommendations he gave us for meals and also coupons for wine, appetizers or dessert. Derek at the pool kept the smoothies coming and kept our wine glasses filled. We booked a one bedroom but were upgraded to a two bedroom with two and a half baths. I think I would have preferred the one bedroom because it had a queen bed and we had two doubles. But,no problem. Someone complained about the stairs. Yes, thre are about 14 steps to get into the unit and then when inside another pair of steps going up to the bedrooms but since we live in a house with stairs it was no problem for us. Staff, from the front desk, to the cleaning crew to the maintenance man who showed my husband how to use the stove (we have gas and they have electric).. Location was great. We are a couple in our early 7-0's and had no problem walking from our hotel to the other end of Duval several times during the week. We did take a cab twice to go to dinner. One of the things we really enjoyed was e-mailing our grocery list to the hotel and then having the groceries in the room when we arrived. We flew to Key West and did not have a car so this was a big help. My husband likes to cook breakfast and we also kept the makings for our gin and tonices in the kitchen as well as cheese and crackers. The grounds are very beautiful and the pools were beautiful and there were plenty of chairs for everyone. The only thing I could complain about was the fact that while the unit was set up for 4 people we only had 3 chairs at the counter in the kitchen. When we travel with anyone else we also like to play cards in the evenng and there was no table. There is room for one in one corner of the living room. But since it was just the two of us there was plenty of room. We did some of the touristy things and then rented an electric car (I don't ride bikes) for a day and drove all over the island. Dinner suggestions from Ken included Camilles, a cute little restaurant within walking distance of the hotel with good food, reasonally priced and Ken gave us a coupon for a free bottle of wine. Ken suggested Louie's Backyard which we were not going to go to because of the bad reviews but he said we would like it and made us dinner reservations and we had an enjoyable time eating outside on the deck over the water. Food was a little overpriced but being from PA where can we go with an atmosphere like that. Our favorite restaurant was Blue Heaven and I can't say enough good things about it. It is a funky fun place with the ambience tht I would expect in Key West. We had a great time in Key West for the 5 days we were there and our stayng at the Santa Maria Suites made the vacation complete.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: clairefgraham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Santa Maria for our honeymoon and we couldn't be happier with our choice. We had a luxury hotel experience for what we felt was a bargain. The rooms are fantastic and spacious, great if you are staying for more than a weekend and you really want to spread out. The hotel grounds are gorgeous and the pool is fabulous, but what really sets the Santa Maria apart is its friendly staff. They were more than willing to offer suggestions on where to go and what to do. An added bonus was the free smoothies and daily happy hour at the pool. The worst part of our trip was going home!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be nicer !!”
Reviews.Author: phil3905
Reviews.Content: I learned about SMS from reading reviews on Trip Adviser. It sounded too good to be true but we flew down for a 5 night stay. We were floored by how nice it is and the management is fabulous. Price is very good for the facilities. We loved the surprises like Dove bars in the fridge. The free smoothies at the pool by Derek were nice to have. It is very convenient but away from the crazy park of Duval street . The in house restaurant Ambrosia was a very good sushi place. Our stay could not have been better and we will stay here on our next trip to Key West

Reviews.Title: “The most incredible place to stay in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: Utopia941
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we walked in to our room and it smelled like fish (they have full kitchens-just because they have a kitchen do you really think cooking fish in your room is a good idea? Come on fellow travelers!) Then my wife discovered no tub (a must for her). I called the front desk and 2 minutes later Lane the Asst Manager met us outside and showed us another room with a tub. She aired out the other room so other travelers would not have to experience the next day. Ok this is the place to stay on Key West. The place is clean and private. This was built as a residential condo property so the rooms are virtually soundproof. ALL of the Staff are great! Gorgeous rooms with flat screen TV, Washer/Dryer, & full kitchens (a great way to save some cash in KW-hit the Publix or Winn Dixie grocery store on your way in.) Beds are very comfortable. Nice touch with muffins, chocolates, ice cream & smoothies/happy hour! We brought our own Robes and Slippers!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: clancy001
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Suites. Only a couple of comments/complaints. When I called to request a ground level entrance I was told "no problem". However, when we arrived we discovered we had to clime a flight of steps to get to the condo...as well as the steps inside the place to get to the bedrooms. We are both Seniors!! Also, since this was our 40th Anniversary trip, I called a couple weeks in advance to have them make reservations for an anniversary dinner, ans was told they would take care of it. Didn't happen, the place we wanted was booked. Everything else was perfect! The staff is excellent and very friendly. Loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL GROUNDS, RELAXING ATMOSPHERE, EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: lifeslittlemeasures
Reviews.Content: I happened to come across Santa Maria Suites when I was searching for a condo in Key West. What a find!!! It is located a block from the end of Duval and two blocks from the Southernmost Point. We rented bikes for the week and never drove our car the whole week except to pick up friends from the airport. We had a two bedroom suite that was immaculate, spacious, and had every comfort of home you would need - - fully furnished. The grounds are gorgeous and the staff are exceptional. They arranged for our bikes, drew maps for all over Key West, gave us great restaurant reviews... Complimentary smoothies by the pool every day, fresh muffins every morning, frozen dove bars and turn down with chocolates every night. We had a FANTASTIC time and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great? Not”
Reviews.Author: grapdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at SMS because of Trip Advisor. It is a very nice property, but definitely not the best place we have stayed in, and $448 a night! While we were checking in, the Front Desk offered some ladies from Ft. Lauderdale, a similar room to ours at $224, or 1/2 of what we paid. It has a lovely kitchen, with state-of-the-art appliances, AND a wine cooler. It has 2 HD TV sets, both showing analog grainy pictures. It has a very comfortable bed, but no choice of pillow size (I like soft, my wife likes firmer). It has two sinks in the bathroom, but they do not have a robe or slippers on the property. To my wife, this is a deal breaker. The location is at the other end of Key West from where the action is, and to not drink and drive, it costs about $10 (with tipe) to take a cab from one end to the other. We tend to stay in 5 star accommodations, and expect to pay for that experience. We paid for it, but didn't get it. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and modernity happily combined”
Reviews.Author: thephotographer11
Reviews.Content: this place is lovely; clean and friendly, with beutifully appointed apartments, tastefully decorated. free smoothies by the pool, dishwashers and washing machines, the only negative is the darkness of the interiors; we needed lights on even in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: “I'm afraid to share the secret!”
Reviews.Author: showbits
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Santa Maria - I can't say enough good things about it. Our daughters are in college and we needed a nice place to relax between the end of their classes and the start of their summer jobs. We all agreed it was the perfect spot for what we wanted. The suite had plenty of room for all of us and the modern kitchen was a plus. Then there were the amenities - the complimentary poolside smoothies, muffins and Dove bars in the room; happy hour wine and snacks; chocolates on the pillows at bedtime - everything enhanced our stay. Compared to the price of the two hotel rooms we would have needed elsewhere, it was a real value.

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar quality!”
Reviews.Author: asmiller429
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location. Very accommodating staff. There was construction taking place next door and the hotel staff relocated us to a room further away, without asking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay With Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rubber_Rylee
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for my sisters wedding and chose the Santa Maria based on the reviews listed on several websites as well as the amenities offered. We are a young family with 2 daughters, a 4 and a 1 year old. Let me start out with the staff was great, very friendly and very helpful at all times. Even the cleaning staff, they were easy going and great with working around the girls nap times. My youngest turned 1 while we there, and the staff helped me find a great bakery to buy a birthday cake and a very nice cafe for the whole family to have dinner and cake at. The pool was clean, and the landscaping was very nice and tropic. The pool side amenities were very nice and endless, right down to the popsicles and smoothies for the kids. Our family stayed at different places around the island, but they wished they had stayed at Santa Maria when they visited us there. Definitley worth the money and we would stay with Santa Maria again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keywest230
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. We stayed in a two bedroom poolview suite. We had four people and there was plenty of room. The bedrooms were on opposites sides with their own bathrooms. There was a kitchen and sitting room between them. The kitchen was very nice with up to date appliances. Large flatscreen tvs in each bedroom and the sitting room even though we never watched them. This is a very small hotel so every room is close to the pool. The pool area was very nice with plenty of chairs. Best of all they give out free smoothies and bottle water at the pool and then each night wine, crackers, and hummus. Nothing is free in key west, so this was very nice. The only drawback for us was that this hotel is located at the opposite end of duval from all the nightlife. We rented a scooter, so it was not an issue for us but it can be quite a walk to the other end of Duval. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: EnglishLady
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 5 nights, this being our 7th visit to Key West. The accommodation and hotel service was excellent as was the pool. The extra touches of the chocolates, ice-creams, smoothies and happy hour wine and snacks were much appreciated and something that we had not previously experienced in Key West. We have previously stayed at other nearby hotels in this area and have to say that this was by far the most modern and it was nice to have a full kitchen which gave us the opportunity to cook one evening. The en suite bathroom in the main bedroom has a double shower and is really nicely tiled. We enjoy walking, therefore the stroll into town wasn't a problem and couldn't believe how quiet it was at night, there were no issues with hearing any other guests, something that we have previously had a problem with in Key West. All suites have two bedrooms and two bathrooms, but if there are only two of you, it is possible to book and they close off one bedroom and a bathroom. We would certainly stay at the Santa Maria again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect home from home in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: chipmcdouglas
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here for 5 nights for a bit of comfort and tropical luxury, though still on a modest budget - as a contrast to chain hotels down the Gulf coast and a villa near Tampa. This boutique hotel was perfect for us - we had a 2 level apartment, beautifully decorated with excellent facilities - a modern well equipped luxury kitchen, HD tv and 2 modern double en suite bedrooms. Theres a balcony overlooking the pool - but our room was to the far end of the complex so views were limited, but it was a quiet room so we were happy. Theres a very comfy community feel as it's a small place, with 2 modest heated pools. But thers an excellent complimentary drinks and snacks service - and Ken the concierge was the perfect host - 'Ken 'till 10' would welcome us back each night with a big grin and was a great finish to the fun nights we had on Key West. It's a block away from Duval street - and the leisurely walk down to the other end of the island is great, takes about 45 mins to an hour, and is one of the highlights of Key West. Theres also some great restaurants nearby - and Ken recommended some real winners. The hotel also has access to a very pretty beach with loungers, and has free wi-fi and - essentially for this end of the island, free parking. It's a little mnore pricey than some chains but - the location is perfect, theres loads of excellent amenities nearby, and the hotel and staff are excellent - we will certainly be returning to Santa Maria Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome upon awesome upon more awesome”
Reviews.Author: Kwoz
Reviews.Content: I wrote about my trip to Key West on my family travel blog: http://katrinawoznicki.com/. I canâ€™t gush enough about Santa Maria Suites, the four-star hotel where we stayed for four nights during our visit to Key West. Itâ€™s far away enough from Duval Street so you have the peace and quiet you paid for, yet close enough to walk to all the shops, restaurants, and beaches if you want to be part of the public sphere. The beach was a three-minute walk from our suite, but thatâ€™s walking at a Florida pace. You can be there in a New York minute if you donâ€™t mind a little sweat. The suites are furnished with modern touchesâ€“lots of brushed stainless steel, clean lines, earth tones, and no floral prints. We also stayed during the week; my impression is that weekends at Santa Maria are in high demand. The rooms are gorgeous and the staff are exceptionally friendlyâ€“the poolside bartender, Derek, is known throughout the Internet world for his delectable smoothies. Be sure to claim a deck chair poolside by 4 pmâ€“thatâ€™s happy hour and it gets busy. A definite must if you're heading to Key West. Try Ana's Cafe across the street--get the coconut (I mean drinking out of a coconut) and the tamales--the perfect lunch.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: tamara69
Reviews.Content: I have to say I did not stay in Key West at all, just a day trip, but walked past this property and was so impressed that I stopped in and asked to see a unit. I was super impressed with the property, friendliness of desk agent and the person showing a unit, not to mention the ahhh factor when seeing a poolside unit on the ground level. You have the best of all worlds to stay here while in Key West. All units are 2 bdrm so obviously best value when travelling with family or another couple. The kitchen was amazing, as was the ensuite to master bdrm. 2nd bdrm has it's own bath as well. Highly highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, spacious rooms, clean-modern decor, secluded part of KW.”
Reviews.Author: Sunseakr
Reviews.Content: Spent four fabulous days at the Santa Maria Suites Resort with a group of girl friends. The suites were spacious, modern, clean and comfortable. Each suite has it's own living room and kitchen, large enought to entertain. The downstairs (king size bed) suites have the best entertaining area in my opinion. The lovely pool area, covered in lush greenery is a peaceful and relaxing place to hang out. (Not to mention, unlimited free wine and fruit drinks by the pool during the day!) The best thing I liked about the hotel is that it is in walking distance from all the attractions and nightlife, but when you've had enough, it is far enough away to allow for a lazy nap by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Come Back to”
Reviews.Author: RunGirl73
Reviews.Content: The customer service by the front desk staff at check-in and by the pool staff during the complimentary happy hour was exceptional, and made us feel welcomed and valued. In addition, the reservation manager handled a miscue in our reservations with a touch of class, both via telephone with me and upon our arrival to our suite where we found a complimentary gift basket as a token of the hotelâ€™s esteem. The complimentary turn-down service had us looking forward to our ice cream each night when we returned from dinner! Our accommodations were top notch, with all the comforts of home. The location of the hotel put is at the sleepy end of the island, away from all the hustle and bustle; but close enough that we were able to walk to the opposite end of Duval, where all the action was, whenever we wanted to. All around, my husband and myself, as well as our friends from out-of-town, agree that we will definitely come back and stay at the Santa Maria for our next visit to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Yunyao
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days in Key West. Santa Maria staff was extremely helpful and generous. The hotel had a great set up for families with the suite format with the two rooms. Relaxing and quiet location but walking distance to restaurants, shops, etc. After visiting the Keys, I would not stay any other place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 19bobcat
Reviews.Content: This was a great vacation due to the staff, cleanliness and location. Can not say enough about our stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “We love Wolfgang!”
Reviews.Author: meggyb143
Reviews.Content: My freinds and I stayed at this amazing resort during spring break and we all loved it! The amentites were outstanding, the staff was welcoming, and the overall atmosphere was extremely relaxing. The rooms were very clean with all of the neccesary accomodations, including the extras such as breakfast muffins, ice cream bars, and coffee. But we all especially loved Wolfgang who worked at the front desk during our stay. He was extrmely nice and hospitable every night when we came home from our evening. All of the staff was excellent but he definetly stood out as our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2000AtlanticGT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my dad and step-mother traveled from Naples, FL down to Key West for a 3 night stay. The service from the staff was excellent and everybody was very helpful whether it was asking about places to eat, getting something for the room, or just talking about the Key West are in general. The staff really makes this place a more enjoyable place to stay. We reserved a two bedroom bi-level luxury suite but upon check in were moved to a ground level two bedroom luxury suite which had king beds instead of queen (which was nice). I was a little disappointed to learn that the master bedroom was the only room with the nice bathroom as shown in the photos, the other bathroom was very nice but much smaller with very little counter space. I went back and checked the description on their website after we returned from vacation and for the the bi-level suites there was no mention of any difference in the bathrooms but the ground level two bedroom suite description does mention this. I was expecting bathrooms for both guest rooms to be as pictured based on the reservations I made so this was a little bit of a disappointment. The rooms were very clean, quiet, and had a well equipped kitchen and in room washer/dryer. The furniture is very modern, looks great, but not the most comfortable for kicking back an relaxing. I spent some time in Japan and it reminds me of the furniture over there, everything was extra firm except for the bed which was wonderful. The covered porch sitting area with chairs in front of every suite was a nice place to sit outside and relax in the evenings. The pool and surrounding tropical decor was perfect for relaxing around the pool and much better than the local beaches. It is a short walk to Duval street but honestly the only thing we found interesting on Duval street was a few great places to eat (Mangoes 4-5 blocks down on the left is great...try it!)

Reviews.Title: “I made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: siuchung
Reviews.Content: My teenage kids found themselves in heaven in this small cozy hotel. When we stepped in the hotel, we were welcome by Ken who made us felt so welcome. Not only did he show us the direction to attractions, he also introduced nearby restaurants after a long walk to Duval Street and Mallroney square. The swimming pool is heated so we could enjoy it even though the temperature is only at high tens. I promised my little daughter we will go back next year although the price is at the high end but it is the most memorable moment for my daughters of the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: sdmVermont
Reviews.Content: Excellent accommodations and great, friendly staff. Ken was very helpful with recommendations and Derek made delicious frozen drinks poolside. The suite was new, with good size bedrooms, complete kitchen and washer & dryer. Muffins, bottled water and Dove bars each day were pleasant surprises!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: zajak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Santa Maria Suites with my husband and teenage son, the hotel was very accommodating from the time of check in. We had a two bedroom duplex overlooking the pool, it clean, modern and spacious. The bedrooms and baths were a little small but more than enough room for the 3 of us. I loved the happy hour at the pool daily, complimentary wine, snacks and smoothies. The location was very convenient to Duval Street and nice to be away from the crowds, it's a nice walk down to Front Street. Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and the hotel restaurant was very good as well. We rented a car but could easily have done without one for the week unless you want to drive to explore the other keys. There are complimentary beach chairs for South Beach which is around the block, the beach isn't great we mainly stayed by the pool. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Spendy and Far-Removed, but Beautiful and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Johann&Sandra
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom pool view suite, and the room was huge and beautiful. We were very impressed. We had the corner suite, which although the view was more roof than pool, it had the advantage of a big tree that while blocking the view also provided privacy and little birds coming up to see what was going on. The corner suite featured 4 balconies, but only one with furniture. The beds were very comfortable and we had three giant flat screen tvs and 2 bathrooms. Granite countertops, tile floors, and a full kitchen were all nice touches, and in very good condition - seemed like new. Wi-fi was free, and worked well from our room. At 4:00 PM every day they served complimentary wine and tidbits (hummus and crackers) by the pool. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Layout was small and cozy except for the workmen outside that started yelling in Spanish at 6:00 AM every morning. Swimming pool area was very nice. Free parking on site. Not everything was good - we arrived with several bags of luggage, but received no offer of help with our bags - instead having to lug them up a flight of stairs by ourselves, and make three trips to the car through the lobby while the staff sat and watched. Housekeeping was spotty - we arrived home to find our balcony door open, the dishwasher still full, garbage not removed from the apartment, and our bathroom goodies not replenished. The location was far removed from Mallory Square - about a 25 minute walk - or they'll call a taxi for you (costs about $6.00). Not much in the immediate area - just the on-site restaurant and one next door at the neighboring hotel. A mini-mart just across the street was convenient though. Overall, a great stay at Santa Maria Suites - if you have lots of luggage watch out though, especially if you have an upstairs room. The price was very high - about $400 a night - but it was very nice and comfortable for 3 people.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: kristysmom01
Reviews.Content: We returned tonight from a full week in this paradise. The service from the office staff was absolutely outstanding - from the umbrella-covered escort to our room the first night to the fabulous food recommendations and cheerful help getting cabs. Poolside smoothies, towels on each chair (and ENOUGH chairs), so many amenities. It was not a perfect stay, yet the recovery of problems was very good in most cases. Problems were related to housekeeping issues - kitchen dish soap provided but no kitchen towels of any kind. When we asked about kitchen towels we were told that is why there is a dishwasher. But no dishwasher soap was available five of the seven days. We had to request shower mats, toilet paper. Requests were generally filled quickly and pleasantly.The turn-down with ice cream AND chocolates was super. We used the exercise room several mornings. Not fancy but effective - bring a towel with you. What we loved was the small community feel of the place, a private enclave yet close to many restaurants and activities. One thing that impressed us immensely was the phone call we received at home one week prior to our trip. The hotel manager was calling to see if we had questions or needed any special arrangements. We have traveled many times but that was a first for us and left a very favorable impression and made us really look forward to our stay. When we arrived we were told we got upgraded to a first floor poolside room that was close to the pool but still quiet and private. I would absolutely recommend this to others and absolutely want to return. Big thanks to all the staff at Santa Maria Suites!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: MrsWinkl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and thought the decor and style in general was very nice. This is not an upscale 4 or 5 star hotel but it was clean and hip and had a good location. It also was pretty well priced (about $250 a night) so for what we paid I thought it was a good choice. The staff was nice (especially Wolfgang at the front desk!) but there are not a ton of employees roaming around to help out. The pool area is nice although we didnt go swimming. The two negatives were that the building where most rooms are backs up to the parking lot so half of your room doesnt have the most charming view. I just kept the curtains closed. Also, the mattress and pillows were pretty low quality. If they replaced those I would give the place an 8 or 9 total (out of 10). I slept fine but you could just feel it was all a bit cheap (not that cushy, maybe a foam mattress? pillows were lumpy). All in all I would stay again based on what I paid and I did enjoy it. Oh wait, just remembered the water pressure was awful! Could barely shower. But, again the price was right. Wish they would fix those couple of things and the place would be perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Propery & Location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl721
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria Suites is the perfect location, off the beaten path from the craziness of Duval Street, but close enough to bike & walk to all of the attractions. We didnt utlize many of the other facilities, but the front desk was a great help with setting up a half day catamaran sail. The bi-level suites are great with a, very clean, well appointed kitchen, washer & dryer, living area, 3 balconies - wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit to Key West”
Reviews.Author: bts10
Reviews.Content: My spouse, teenage children and I stayed at the Santa Maria Suites from 2/14/10 to 2/19/10. Our suite was clean and functional. Stephanie, Ken and Derek were all very helpful in assisting us with our daily excursions as well as offering some great ideas. We enjoyed the turndown service each night with chocolates, muffins and ice cream. The weather was unseasonably cold and limited some of the activities we had planned so I would like to visit again with warmer weather. I would recommend the Santa Maria Suites and would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: RetirementGlory
Reviews.Content: We stopped here by chance and from our first encounter with the young people running the hotel we were impressed. Ken, who checked us in, Derek and Steff, who worked around the pool, and everyone we encountered went out of their way to be helpful and friendly. We asked for suggestions for dinner and nightlife and enjoyed every recommendation. While we were quite a bit older than the "kids" who gave us the advice, yet they hit a "home run" on every recommendation. The facilities were fantastic. Very modern, clean, and spacious. The courtyard was an oasis of tranquility, sun, and leisure, while just outside was all the fun of Key West. We had our bicycles with us, which made the transit up Duval to the "crazy end" a pleasant bit of exercise to catch sunset on Mallory followed by dinner and an evening of Key West's pleasures. We are newly retired and will return to Key West and Santa Maria again next winter. A highlight of our first retirement trip to Fla.

Reviews.Title: “A very civilised place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: PikeyJohnPat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my wife and some friends. Thoroughly enjoyed the ambience and the service, pity about the unseasonal weather. Would like to return one day if the opportunity arises Wonderful spot to stay in Key West, rather pricey but worth every penny. Shame we didn't get our 'turn down ' chocs on the pillows! A great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small Luxury Hotel? You have gotta be kidding me!”
Reviews.Author: Santani
Reviews.Content: We planned our first ever trip to Key West, Florida to celebrate Valentine's day and were hoping to relax, learn about this wonderful southernmost tip of continental United States. We selected Santa Maria for its location, a conversation with the hotel and based on the amenities we were looking for. What a disappointment!! We were going to arrive late, so we not only confirmed our reservation, we kept the desk night manager informed of our progress during our drive so that we could ensure someone will be there to check us in. The check-in process was adequate and OK. Not particularly at par with what you would expect at a member hotel of Small Luxury Hotel collection of places around the world. In fact inexpensive hotel chains do a better and a more friendly job. We had already been charged one night's deposit on my partner's credit card. At check-in, I specifically mentioned that the rest of the charges were to be settled on my card, which I presented, and an imprint was taken. No mention was made of the fact that the unit we were assigned had a completely non-functioning, broken dishwasher, which we had to discover when went to use it, and in the process we discovered that it was filthy and dirty in addition to completely inoperable. Additionally, there was odious odor and there were small insects crawling on the kitchen counter. There was no one to call as they leave for the night (!) with an ability to leave a voice mail! We were hoping they would move us to another unit so we did not have to pack/unpack the next day or fix the dishwasher. We left a message. The next morning, I called them. A very rude and a curt young lady answered and when I asked if they had gotten my message, she apparently had no clue about what I was talking about. She lectured me that they have someone investigating and that it was still early in the morning for them to have gotten back to us. This is not true since I was calling around 8 30 AM and they claim to have someone come in the morning at 6 AM. I inquired what it is that they were investigating because someone obviously should have known that the dishwasher was not working, if their housekeeping staff had cleaned the unit before we arrived. There were curt answers, and a vague comment about if we have another room we will get back to you, and that, if not, just leave the dishes dirty, and the cleaning staff will clean it the NEXT day!! There are not enough dishes, utensils or other cutlery for even two people to have more than two meals a day without cleaning the dishes!! I insisted that the desk person tell me whether they already knew ahead of our checking in that the dishwasher was broken. She would not answer and told me if I had any more problems, I could talk to the general manager. I said I want to be connected. The gentleman was initially not very sympathetic but as the conversation progressed, he volunteered that there is no chance of fixing the dishwater during our stay as it was waiting for a part that had been ordered!! At the time of the check-in, this was not mentioned, when I called next morning, the woman at the desk, brusquely told me they were investigating, and yet, through irritated persistence, I finally discover they knew all along that the dishwasher had not functioned for at least some time! The matter of insects crawling and filthy dishwasher (it not working is one thing, it being filthy takes some work!) were not addressed but I was told they will move our refrigerated food, and our personal belongings to another unit at some point in the day. Imagine! Someone moving your food! We moved most of our stuff ourselves although a gentleman was there to help us if we needed it! Some luxury hotel!! They also offered half of one day's worth of credit. We had wasted a lot of time already and wanted to get on with our stay so I simply accepted the situation. To add insult to injury, they charged me and my partner separately on two different credit cards, for two units: the one we were in the first night, and also for the second unit to which we were moved on day 2! No receipt, and this despite my specific request to charge only one card and only one room. I was told that is exactly what would happen. We only discovered that we had been overcharged almost $732 dollars extra because my partner and I are diligent about checking our credit card charges before even the regular bill arrives! She was hesitant even to bring it up to me but thought the better of it to make sure that we were both not charged, since I had told her that I had settled thebill at checkout with my credit card. How embarrassing that she had to ask me if I was charged too! This was a Valentine's day celebration!! I called last night, with my partner and I on the phone together. They do not have access to billing data and would I please call in the morning when the people who handle the accounting are available to fix this small 'faux pas!' I let the gentleman know in no uncertain terms that I expect him to take care of it, I am not going to keep calling them and in these economic times or in any other times, to politely but infuriatingly to say to a customer that $732 erroneous double charge is a small faux pas really takes the cake. We are waiting for them to correct the error, and as of 9 30 AM, no calls, no e mails yet! There are other properties in Key West we would rather have been, paid a lot less, and accepted lesser amenities than to stay at a Small Luxury Hotel collection member, waste our time getting people to own up to known defects in the promised amenities, and be double charged, and now have to waste more time waiting for them to reverse the erroneous charges. I not only do not recommend this property, I suggest you avoid it entirely. A very disappointing experience, and gestures such as half of one day's rental and a fruit basket do not adequately give us our wasted time back! I would rather have paid full price as we were intending to all along and the establishment be forthright, efficient and diligent in matters of service and accounting process. Not my experience at all at Santa Maria and certainly not my experience at any of the world-wide members of Small Luxury Collection of hotels where I have stayed over the past 40 years!

Reviews.Title: “Just loved the Santa Maria Suites”
Reviews.Author: queen_mary
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights including our wedding anniversary and couldn't have been happier. Wonderful apartment, lovely setting, helpful friendly staff and in a quiet location. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a getaway weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: INeedAVacationMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I joined another couple for a celebratory weekend in Key West selecting Santa Maria Suites for our lodging based on reviews from this site. We were absolutely delighted with the accomodations, location, and service. The two bedroom suites are modern, clean, and well equipped. It's a fabulous place - definitely plan to stay here again for our next trip to Key West. And it is 1 - 2 blocks from Louie's Backyard. Heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for traveling with another couple or friends”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrav-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a two-bed, two-bath suite with a friend this past weekend. While a bit pricey, it was cheaper than booking two separate rooms other places, with the added bonus of a shared eating and living area (and laundry in-suite!). We were very happy with the property overall; it is extraordinarily clean, the staff is absolutely wonderful (especially Derek and Steph, the poolside concierges), the pool is delightful with its little bar and abundant lounge chairs, and there a lots of pleasant little complementary surprises, like muffins in the morning, chocolate and ice cream at night, and smoothies by the pool. This place would be absolutely perfect for couples traveling together who like some togetherness but still some privacy, or just friends in search of a relaxing time. The beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Our quibbles with the place are minor, but are worth mentioning as they may help my fellow Tripadvisees. First, for a two bedroom suite with Sub-Zero applicances, more than a four-pot coffee maker should be standard. We made like four pots of coffee a morning! The manager tells me that they will soon have 10-pot makers on request, so ask if you want one (but I still think they should be standard in a hotel of this quality). Oh, and if you like coffee, buy some at the grocery, the in-room Maxwell House stuff is terrible. Second, while the beds are heaven, the furnishings in the living room are dreadfully uncomfortable. This, too, should be changing soon, according to the manager. Third, rainfall shower heads. I hate rainfall shower heads (gimme a good blast from standard head any day). Stylish, yes, practical, no. Finally, as it is a new place built with condos in mind, it has no Key West soul. It is all modern beige and black, and I totally realize that some people love that, but we like a little more of a vibe in our KW housing. But, KW vibe usually means bright and a little rundown, and this place is pristine, so there is your trade off. Oh, and it is in with a lot of other resort properties, so there isn't much of that great residential feel a lot of the island has, but it is totally convenient to all of that. And it is really close to the Southernmost Beach area, which you have access to with your card from SMS. That was really nice. Overall, we would consider the SMS first if we were traveling with friends (or if we end up having kids, I didn't say that before, but this would be a great set up for kids).

Reviews.Title: “Most memorable hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: kwnewlywed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Santa Maria Suites in November 2009 for our wedding. Everything met or exceeded out expectations. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The suites were incredible. Everything was modern and in good condition. This was probably the first time we have wanted to stay in our room during a vacation. The price is a little steep, but if you share the room with others I think the quality of the hotel plus the great service makes it worth every penny. Next time we visit Key West we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apart-hotel!”
Reviews.Author: superstar311
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for a friends wedding. Four of us were traveling together and we thought that an apart-hotel was the best way to go. We chose this hotel off tripadvisor reviews and it really was great! We had a fab 2 bedroom/2 bathroom apartment with kitchen and living room over looking the pool. It was very spacious and the showers were excellent. The rooms were up to date, modern and clean. Only regret is that we hardly spent any time at the hotel and didn't have the opportunity to enjoy it fully. Tip: Would definitely recommend the pulled pork sandwich at the Cuban cafe across the street!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cb1062
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Santa Maria Suites. This is a great hotel for families. It's located on the quiet end of Duval Street, but there is still plenty of activity. The suite has two bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen and living room. We stopped at the local food store and bought snacks and drinks. The staff here are fantastic. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Ken booked our fishing trip for us, had restaurant suggestions and even helped print our boarding passes. Every night the staff comes in with muffins, Dove ice cream bars and mini chocolates. We'll definitely be returning here on our next trip to key West.

Reviews.Title: “Most incredibly sophisticated suite...at a really attractive price!”
Reviews.Author: bocarealtor
Reviews.Content: We usually reserve a suite in any hotel and must confess that the one we had at this beautiful resort hotel exceeded all expectations. There is a 42" TV in each bedroom and the living room and that is just the beginning. The master bath has a spacious double headed shower that is glass enclosed and shares the room with twin wash bowl sinks! The second bedroom had it's own lovely bath. The kitchen is a state of the art experience with pull out refrig and freezer drawers in the granite topped island. All appliances are amazing! The fresh muffins brought to our door in the evenings, the complimentary Dove ice cream and Dove chocolates, and the quality complimentary toiletries all spoke volumes about the way the management of this unique hotel values it's guests! And all hotel personnel made us more than welcome!!! What a unique and marvelous home away from home. I had better stop now or I'll sound like a paid advertisement. In all good faith, don't miss this jewel! Martin Baker

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Quiet and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Mandemhamm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and two young daughters. We were very pleasantly surprised with the accomodations, location and service. Santa Maria Suites are located off Duval at the quiet end, near many local tourist sites, beaches, shopping and restaurants. The rooms were trendy, cozy and very comfortable. We enjoyed having a full kitchen for our daughters and thoroughly enjoyed the pools. We highly recommend Santa Maria Suites.

Reviews.Title: “A few nice things to say”
Reviews.Author: travelbh
Reviews.Content: Clean, stylish, modern, accomodating, friendly, relaxing. This is a great place to spend a few days in Key West in luxurious surroundings, a few minutes from anywhere you might want to be (a car, scooter, bike, or electric car is really a great thing to have here.) There are great restaurants nearby, beautiful stores and galleries. The management here couldn't be more helpful if they tried. (One downside is that all the beds seem to be queen or king sized) so if you have need for twin beds you had better know that in advance (memo to ownership: get beds like on cruise ships that can either be made together (as a king queen) or separate as twins. Come here expecting the best and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Beautiful Surroundings!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jast64
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria Suites is located in the quieter side of Key West, just two blocks away from the "Southernmost Point of the US", and about 10 minutes walk from Hemingway's House. It is one of the few hotels close enough to the historic city that accept small children. Our kids enjoyed the nice swimming pool, and daily ice cream. The suites are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable, the only drawbacks are the small size of the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Big on service”
Reviews.Author: janbo19
Reviews.Content: We loved the service @Santa Maria. Everyone was helpful, cheerful, and personable... however, we were not thrilled with the actual design of the rooms. We never did figure out the dual shower heads in our bathroom. One was for hot water and one was for cold water & it was supposed to mix in the middle? Hmmm, just give me a normal shower head, please. We easily stubbed our toes on the beds if we weren't careful... watch out! There's glass in the bathroom door, so if one of us wakes up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and turns on the bathroom light, the whole bedroom lights up and the partner wakes up, too. Not too smart. It looks good, but did not work for us. We could've used one more couch in the living area, as there were 3 of us. The cute little round chairs were not comfortable. The amenities were outstanding... we loved that there was laundry soap for us to use in the washer; there was dish soap for the kitchen; an endless supply of chocolates - in both frozen form and on our beds... muffins in the morning... beverages & fresh fruit at the pool. The staff gets high marks for service. And the service was outstanding! Would we go again? Hmmmm, good question!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service - we can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: VAbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for our anniversary and stayed at Santa Maria Suites for a week. The location was perfect for our lifestyle - a block from the QUIET end of Duval Street. It's a mile (easy walk or taxi) from the party-party (north) end of Duval Street. The hotel has a beautiful courtyard with pool and pool concierge where we enjoyed relaxing - the concierge provides towels, water, smoothies, friendly travel/restaurant advice, etc. I felt like Lindsey and Derek were old friends by the time we left. The front desk also assisted in making dinner reservations and booked us on a catamaran trip. The suite we stayed in (33) was essentially a very narrow town house. Downstairs was a narrow living room with huge flat screen TV, a half bathroom, stack laundry, and a kitchen with big counter and bar stools. Upstairs were two bedrooms, each with its own full bathroom. Other noteworthy amenities included free parking (rare in Key West since real estate is at a premium), and a small exercise room. Everything was newly renovated and top of the line. We could not have been more comfortable here, were sad to have to leave, and definitely will return. Some "constructive criticism" I'd like to pass to the hotel, since I believe as wonderful as any place is, there's always room for improvement: 1) Since everything at Santa Maria Suites is first class, please consider replacing the Maxwell House coffee you put in the kitchens. It is awful. (On the positive side, since the coffee provided was so bad, it motivated me to go across the street to the little Cuban take out for their most excellent Cafe con Leche.) 2) Please consider putting bathrobes in your suites, as many luxury hotels do. 3) Is there anyway to spray for or control the mosquitos in the courtyard? I was bitten many times, especially if I was outside at dusk. Overall, these are extremely minor issues, and we love the Suites. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation within a vacation”
Reviews.Author: QueenJns
Reviews.Content: We just completed a mini-getaway to Key West where we stayed at the Santa Maria Suites. We stayed in a first floor pool-view suite, which was breathtaking. It is furnished with the most up-to-date applicances and furnishings. The staff was friendly yet unintrusive. I have read some reviews about the location but we felt the location was perfect for relaxing AFTER experiencing Key West. Being from Miami, we drove down so we didn't have the issues that some people had with getting to Duval Street. We are definately going back, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoteltraveler40
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our visit to the Santa Maria Suites in Key West. Property is one block from Duval Street, but at one end and not in the heart of the tourist action. We did not mind being a little bit away from the action. It is near to the Southernmost Hotel and the Reach Resort. It is not on the water; the only water you will see is the hotel pool. However, the beach is only a block away. You are able to make use of the lovely beach at the Southernmost hotel. You must bring your room key to show them. We had a 2-bedroom bi-level suite, The kitchen and bathrooms were lovely, with high end appliances and fixtures. Breakfast is not provided, but you are given muffins, coffee and ice cream treats to tide you over. There are 3 supermakets in the business area of town: Publix, Winn Dixie and Albertsons. If you have a car, you can easily stop there at the begiinng of your stay to obtain provisions. (I prefer Publix.) Our room was very clean and well maintained by housekeeping staff. All staff at hotel were very pleasant. Parking is free. The only negative thing is that walls are thin, and if your neighbors wake up early, so will you.The same hard surface floors and countertops that contribute to the cleanliness of the facility also make it a bit noisier than the average hotel. Would I stay here again? Yes. Would I recommend it to a friend? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “High Class!”
Reviews.Author: DrDanHsu
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews are spot on! This place is furnished and decorated in with top-of-the-line furniture, appliances and fixtures. I wanted to move in! I felt like I was in a house in the Hamptons! I even got some ideas on how to renovate MY house! I paid for a one-bedroom suite (they're all two bedrooms. One just gets locked) but the other bedroom was left open anyway. Amenities included marble counter tops, dual drawer Sub-Zero below-counter fridge and freezer, oven, range, dishwasher, food processor...in short, a fully stocked modern kitchen. There was a flat screen tv in every room. The living room TV had a dvd player and a/v inputs built into the wood console. Dual sink, dual overhead shower in the en-suite master bathroom. All the rooms face the pool. Parking at the property is ample and free. Check-in is a breeze. Smoothies and bottled water are provided during the day and are free as are the daily complimentary muffins, coffee and tea in your room. I almost didn't want to leave this little property! Some people say it's a bit out of the way, but I really wouldn't want to stay in the seedy, noisy dives in town anyway. And trust me, rent a car! I paid 12.95/day which is less than a scooter and much more comfortable and safe! Finally, remember that key West is very honky tonk. There is no glitz or glam. Ladies, leave your baubles at home!

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all!”
Reviews.Author: kthomas14
Reviews.Content: We (me and my 14 year old daughter) stayed at Santa Maria Suites 11-25-2009 until 11-26-2009. It was wonderful!! I was impressed at how clean everything was. Everynight, someone came in a turned down our beds and left candy on our pillows and fresh muffins in the kitchen, ice cream in the freezer. I did have to visit the office to have a item restocked (we used too much) not because it was not there. The person who brought it was waiting at the door when I got back. Large rooms!!! Will be there as soon as possible!!!!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel Large rooms with free car parking. Nice pool area free towels and soft drinks during the day. At one end of Duval street near the southern most point in America The drive from Miami South Beach was over 5 hours as so many miles are driven at the 45 mph speed limit. There is little view on the drive south or north, so stay 2 nights in Key west. Try eating at Hard Rock

Reviews.Title: “5-star stay!”
Reviews.Author: Onthelam67
Reviews.Content: Our love of Santa Maria Suites (SMS) started before we ever arrived...Lindsay went shopping for us so we would have breakfast items and cocktail hour snacks during our stay. I just emailed our shopping list to her and the items were waiting for us when we arrived on Thursday evening - how wonderful is that? We were only charged a service fee of 10% of the grocery total...a fantastic bargain and a value-added service to be sure! We were blown away by the quality of the two-bedroom, pool view suite and immediately made it our home. Our balcony was a great place to unwind with a glass of wine and watch the breeze in the palms. The king beds were comfortable, the linens soft and the bath towels outstanding. The kitchen had high-end appliances and was well-stocked with all the accessories necessary. One tiny little downside is that in comparison to the other appliances the tiny four-cup Cuisinart coffee maker didn't make much sense BUT Wolfgang made sure we got another one so we could at least make two pots at a time (there were four of us - all big morning coffee drinkers.) We also took advantage of the in-suite washer and dryer to give our swimsuits a cold water rinse and dry after a day of parasailing, snorkeling and kayaking...all arranged for us by Lindsay! Because each of us had carry-on bags we didn't have sunscreen for our day in the sun, but no worries, Stephanie by the pool made sure we had plenty of 50 spf sun protection before we left! Nightly turndown service includes Dove ice cream treats, chocolates on the pillow and fresh muffins for the next morning...see what I mean? The list just goes on and on with amazing guest services! Thanks SMS for making our annual girlfriends trip an amazing experience...we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Everthing I was looking for and WAY more!”
Reviews.Author: jgraterole
Reviews.Content: Where to begin! From the moment you walk into this hotel, you know you're a very welcomed guest. Check in was very smooth, and they even give you a little card with a poetic welcome - very cute detail! We rented two 2-bedroom pool-view suites, and the proximity to the pool made us spend more time at the hotel than the actual streets - and we were there for Fantasy Fest! They have free poolside smoothies and water, and the suites were absolutely AMAZING - we made good use of everything in them: the washer and dryer, wine cooler, refrigerator and freezer, TV, stove and oven, microwave, dishwasher, and even kitchen utensils! We had brought our own food and drinks, so all this made it very convenient for our large group. I do have to extend a BIG thanks to the hotel manager, because even though it was only 12 of us staying between both suites, we attracted many other friends to our hotel, and he never gave us a hard time about it - instead, he was very attentive and involved, but without it feeling intruding! They are also very organized when it comes to cleaning - they have a cleaning "team", so it's about four people at a time that come clean up your suite! Bedrooms were very comfortable and spacious, and having two sinks and two shower heads in the master bedroom was an absolute plus! Parking was free the entire weekend, as they do have a lot right by the hotel. The location was just perfect - less than a block away from Duval, and within walking distance to all the restaurants and bars... You WILL love this hotel, because you will find yourself wanting to spend more time enjoying it than you've probably ever have at any other hotel you've stayed in! Definitely booking again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish accomodations, great location and superior service in Key West”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGirl073
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Santa Maria Suites in Key West is impressive. One block north of Duval Street, its location is walking distance from the majority of attractions in the city. The exterior and interior of the buildings is sleek and stylish - it had a sophisticated South Beach appearance mixed with the comfortable feel people expect when traveling in the Keys. Our particular unit had 2 bedrooms and 2 1/2 baths w/ three balconies, a kitchen and a living room. One of the most refreshing apects of the Santa Maria Suites was never feeling as though I was being 'nickle and dimed'; there was no additional charge for parking, the turn down service included complimentary ice cream, muffins and bottled water in the refrigerator and chocolate on the pillows. There were also 'extras' given out around the pool - a steel drum band, wine, and appetizers. The staff was helpful and welcoming so we felt at ease upon arrival and throughout the duration of our stay. At a time when many businesses are cutting back at the expense of consumers, it was wonderful to be pampered.

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service I've ever experienced, bar none!”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPickyPatty
Reviews.Content: If you are seeking a first class suite for two couples, don't look any further than Santa Maria. We were spoiled royally by poolside concierge with iced towels, fruit smoothies, sunscreen (no extra charges); the great sushi restaurant on site, Ambroisa (very convenient for finiky eaters); the extremely cordial front desk staff who greeted us each and every time we passed, and who patiently answered all our questions, since this was our first trip to Key West. The room was very chic with back-lighted milk glass in the kitchen area. Granite countertops, refridgerated and freezer drawers including endless ice cubes. Three large wall mounted flat screen TVs. Our marble tiled bath included two rainfall shower heads and double basins. Everywhere we went, we were told Santa Maria is the best place to stay in Key West and we agree!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place”
Reviews.Author: jake56Ohio
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for my daughter"s wedding at the Reach Resort. Checked out the Reach and it was a beautiful hotel, but for about the same price but a LOT more room we chose the Santa Maria. This place is gorgeous and the staff couldn't have been friendlier. We had two bedrooms, 2 1\2 baths, living room and a fully equipped kitchen. We saved quite a bit of money by not having to eat all our meals out.They would leave chocolates, small ice cream bars and fresh muffins everynight. They served free smoothies and water at the pool area. All of this plus free parking and NO resort fee tacked on everyday . We had a small problem with our bill but the manager and assistant manager took care of it promptly. Very nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel of Key West”
Reviews.Author: dcotix
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers what no other hotel in Key West can ... Brand new luxurious Suites nestled within a private lagoon-like enclave with an abundance of lush tropical landscaping. Our room had every modern comfort imaginable, from flat screen televisions, to gorgeous marble and glass bathrooms and showers, to a beautiful professional kitchen with granite countertops. The staff is just what you'd expect - island friendly and anxious to meet your every need and desire. And the complimentary poolside fruit smoothies made us never want to leave. Staying anywhere else would be a mistake. We are already planning our next vacation to the Santa Maria Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jkoney
Reviews.Content: We took a late flight into Key West and made it to the Santa Maria suites a little before 11pm. We were the last people to check in for the evening, the front desk attendant was expecting us, and had our rooms ready. Check in was smooth and he took us to our rooms and showed us around. We have stayed at some 5 star properties around the world and rooms at the Santa Maria suites can compete with any of them. All the rooms are suites so we had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a full kitchen, and family room area. The bedrooms are comfortable with king size beds and we slept great even on the first night (usually it takes a day to adjust). The bathrooms are very cool with double vessel sinks and rain showers; and a kitchen that rivals my own home. All the rooms are around the shared courtyard with a pool that cannot be more than 20 steps away for anyone. Make sure to check out the Japanese restaurant (Ambrosia) as well. Overall an awesome stay. If we are back in Key West, we will definitely choose the Santa Maria Suites again

Reviews.Title: “Key West best and worst.”
Reviews.Author: mykenlisa
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our 2 night, 3 day stay in Key West and were pleasantly surprised with our accommodation - Santa Maria Suites was amazing! Gorgeous tropical setting around a beautiful pool with FREE smoothies throughout the day which our kids loved...and FREE internet access which I loved! The suite was a 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bathroom apartment spread over 2 levels with a kitchen and lounge area as well as laundry which was much appreciated after being away for a couple of weeks. The mini icecreams in the fridge and chocolates on the bed were also a nice touch. The best meal we had in Key West (and in fact during our whole 30 day US holiday) was at the Brazillian churrascaria restaurant (can't remember the name), just off Duval Street. It is a must for all travellers. The most amazing meat, salads, and service! I have since been trying to find a similar restaurant in Australia since returning home! Duval Street is a great area to wander down with lots of lovely boutiquey shops and interesting cafes. My 2 daughters had their hair braided with the lovely English lady who has the braid shop there....so nice! She did a fantastic job. Our only negative about our whole Key West experience was the man on Duval Street who has the snakes, parrots and iguana that you can hold and have your photo taken with....NOT NICE! We went up to him, with my 9 & 8 year old daughters very excited, to ask about having a photo taken with the creatures. He said it was $20 per child (which we found to be quite excessive) and before we could turn and leave he had sat the girls down and put the snake around them...of course putting us on the spot! One daughter asked if she could pat the bird and in the blink of an eye he wisked off the snake and put a couple of the birds on them and then turned to us and said, not to worry, it would only be $30 for it all! They were not sitting there for any longer than 45 seconds in all...I only had time to take 2 snap shots and then the animals were off them and he had his hand out! This really annoyed us as we didn't agree to his price but he then put us on the spot demanding his $30 which of course we had to pay! Watch out for this man as he is a TOTAL RIP-OFF and left a bad taste in our mouth. The rest of the Key West traders did their absolute best to encourage tourists and make them feel welcome but this man was doing his best to destroy their good work! Someone needs to have a chat to him....and whilst you're at it....we'd love our money back...or at least $25 of the $30 we paid! Not sure if we will venture back to Key West, as much as we enjoyed it; the car drive there was long and boring, and at low speed limits for most of it the trip seemed to drag on. Thankfully we had the serenity of a lovely resort at the end of it. Thanks to the nice people of Key West for making our visit enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: sansik
Reviews.Content: we had a wondeful time in key west. the appartment was awesome. beautiful, quiet , clean, high standard. would be nice with some friend and with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor housekeeping and service”
Reviews.Author: PusurOslo
Reviews.Content: The main reason for choosing this resort was the ranking on Tripadvisor, including the many positive reviews from former guests. And at a first glance the resort seemed to meet our expectations. The physical surroundings were very good with great rooms, a nice pool area, plenty of parking, nice and quiet location etc. Hovever we soon discovered that this was not the entire picture. Especially housekeeping was poor. In fact, during our stay it did not seem that our room was washed properly one single day. Also we did not receive any new towels, nor did we get sufficient toiletries. We had to call for this at the front desk every day. Our room had two balconies. Only one had chairs. We know for a fact that there should have been 2 chairs and a table on the balcony. The free internet access did not work inside the suite, only at the balcony and the pool area. One of the light bulbs over the sink in the bathroom was not in order upon arrival. We had to report this three times before it was taken care of. Surely one has to expect more of a resort of this standard and price range. Although Santa Maria Suites has a great location and offers delicate and spacious suites, the property should be careful and not rest on old merits and Trip Advisor laurels.

Reviews.Title: “Top class 2 bed suite”
Reviews.Author: AKONHOLIDAY
Reviews.Content: Booked as Late room deal and were originally offered smallish suite with Queen bed on 1st floor - quickly moved to Suite no 1 which was on the ground floor and was much more upmarket, trendy and spacious. Loved the kitchen / lounge facilities. Quieter end of Key West. Rented cycles took us quickly wre we needed to go. Definitely a gem!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place you are looking for! WE LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: newmoney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and we LOVE IT! The staff is so friendly... we end up chatting with them all the time and they get us extra water and toiletries when we need them. Cleaning staff isn't always on time, but they get there and do a great job! We got the villa this time instead of the flat. I think next time we will get the flat again because the rooms are bigger even though both masters don't have bathrooms. The kitchen is large and fully equipped... there is plenty of room for extra drinks and frozen food. We went by the pool and got our slushies on Saturday which are awesome. So overall this place rocks and it's right by Duval... not too far from Mallory Square (but take a cab). This is definitely the place you want to stay when you're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Rated #1 for a reason: Beautiful place, luxurious rooms, great staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1024_9
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we have stayed at in a very long time. We were in Key West for our first visit and had stayed the night before at the Reach Resort, right next door, and were really disappointed with that property (small room, surly staff, overheated pool, muddy beach). We had seen the Trip Advisor reviews for Santa Maria and came in to take a look. It was even better than the reviews had described. Our two-bedroom, BEAUTIFUL, luxuriously appointed apartment was available at the same rate as our simple room at the Reach next door. We could not believe the difference. Tatiana at the Front Desk was amazing -- she helped us with all restaurant arrangements, provided free smoothies for our kids, and made us feel completely at home. The rest of the staff were also wonderful. We can't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel ! Fantastic Staff ! Miss it already.”
Reviews.Author: floyd28
