Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth every penny. The apartment is beautiful and the kitchen nicer than mine at home! The kids loved the fruit smoothies and ice lollys that the lovely lady by the pool brings to you. Although we struggled in Key West to find child friendly bars the hotel made up for the lack of evening entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria made the Key West vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JMandTM
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria was outstanding! The web site makes the place look gorgeous... and it is exactly as pictured. Further, the staff is friendly, helpful and knowedgeable. Totally first class. The whole family loved the stay. No nickle and dime approach to their guests. Every day smoothies at the pool, wine at the pool on weekends, Godiva ice cream treats every night, and the muffins were awesome. I would go back to Santa Maria in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BretBon
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying we go to Key West about twice a year and stay at a guest house. This is the best resort in Key West and it is on the quiet side (south end) near the beaches. The 2-bedroom condos are big with 3 flat screen t.v.'s, sub zero refrigerator, great furnishings and 2 shower heads in the shower. The pool is nice with free bottled water and smoothie's(bring your own rum). These condo's were built 2 years ago for sale and it only sold around half of the 36 units. A management company came in and rents the units all year round. The price is great and the area is perfect. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and overall, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: albanianvisitor
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria was few blocks to Downtown and not far from attractions. The condo was beauiful, with bedrooms and two bathrooms with a living room and an open space kitchen with everthing you needed to cook if you wanted. They were two swimming pools that weren't that big but they were ok. It stayed open 24 hours and served juice and fruits. Also, next door there was an Asian restaurant, not too pricey and served good food. These condos had housekeeping everyday and the service was great. The hotel didn't have a beach, but you could go to the other hotel next door from the garage (We learned this the last 3 days). You definetly need a car to shop and to see the Keys. The best beach was Smathers Beach, although it was a bit rocky and you had to pay to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 2 bedroom 2.5 bath with FULL KITCHEN and Washer/Dryer - I loved it and will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: delraylocal
Reviews.Content: Tip #1 - you will want to bring breakfasts, and there are pots and pans, and a wine refrigerator, so you could save alot of money and have all the comforts of home. Tip#2 - FREE smoothies (all day) and wine (after 4) by the pool, and live island music. This was a last minute find that I will never forget. Great balconies tropical setting, helpful people. ** Italian restaurant a few blocks west was EXCELLENT! Abbondanza, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katiekates99
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised at this place! The suites are very modern/contemporary. We stayed in an upstairs one with 2 bedrooms with queen beds. The amenities are awesome. The pool rocks! It is a saline pool with beautiful, lush surroundings that included cute lil lizards that thankfully for me, kept to themselves. We got a choice from 3 different smoothies or water, as well as the popsicles that were passed around from time to time by the pool area. Loved the dove chocolates on my bed every night AND they found and put the TV remote on my bed, which they turned down. We also noticed delicious muffins and little ice cream bars in the kick-butt kitchen every night. Ken 'til 10 rocks as well as the night shifter, Wolfgang, and the Early Bird, Lindsey. They all were so helpful and seemed to know EVERYTHING. They also take great pictures if ya just ask :) . This is the "quiet side" of Duvall. There are beaches very close--one within like a block that also has a restaurant and Higgs beach isn't too far to walk either. It is caddy cornered to a market where you can drink out of a coconut and also a moped rental place. You HAVE to rent a moped while you are there. I swear it's the way to go. I drove all over that place and definitely decided Santa Maria was the best place. We were so lucky because when we picked it, we had no idea how great the location, service and suites were. Another definite MUST is to eat at the Conch Republic and the Cuban restaurant called Pepe's by Mallory Square. By the way-Mallory Square has great artists and entertainers. Blue Heaven restaurant was great for breakfast or lunch. Fogarty's on Duvall was great too. And you have to go to the Hemingway House, of course! Now, if you go in July, like we did, expect it to feel like you are in a sauna. The A/C worked great in the suites though!! I have stayed in a lot of places in many, many cities and this one is definitely unique, with an extremely friendly staff. Great place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well earned Key West #1 rating!”
Reviews.Author: Janlyn5
Reviews.Content: Husband and I recently stayed @ Santa Maria Suites for 3 nights. What a great, relaxing place! The suites are nicely appointed, the front desk service was excellent, the housekeeping staff was friendly and efficient. The pools are super-- beautifully landscaped ! The smoothies, dove chocolates and dove ice cream were such a nice touch.. oh, and the evening muffins were fabulous. Although it is a long hot walk to the Duval street haunts and the Wharf.. it was a great place to stay, and worth all the walking.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return in a Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: KarenOBroomall_PA
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped foot on the property we all knew we were in for something special. This place is as close to perfect as one can expect. The staff will bend over backwards to make sure that you are having the time of your life. A special Thanks to Lindsay, Wolfgang and Tatiana. I never saw them without a smile on their face or a skip in their step. For a small fee they will do your grocery shopping and have everything set up for you when you check in. All of our groceries were put away and some displayed in the kitchen (fruit bowl). I would definately recommend this. The beer was on ice and the soda and water as well. The rooms are spotless. My husband and I traveled with our 15 year old daughter and her friend. They couldn't wait to check the freezer each night for the mini dove bars. The fresh muffins and smoothies were also a big hit. We stayed for 9 nights and everyday was paradise. There was even live entertainment by the pool on Saturday afternoons. We ate at Ambrosia twice and the Sushi was some of the finest we have ever had. We are still telling every one we know how fabulous this place is and are planning a couples trip for next year. Only one downer the sofa and living room chairs are not that comfortable they should consider changing that. With that being said I still give them a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “No water view.”
Reviews.Author: kingbMemphis
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of 2 adults and 1 teenager. As indicated on their website, Santa Maria Suites is not located on water. However, for the price, I found the accomodations very good. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 2.5 bath 2 level condo. Condo has a full kitchen. The beds were queen size (?) and are very low to the ground. However, rooms and linens appeared very clean. There is daily housekeeping. Rooms were small, but comfortable. Next time, I would request a unit on 1 level with a king bed - if available. It is approx a 1 mile + walk to the heart of Duvall Street and the walk appeared to be safe, even late at night. I would not recommend for travelers with teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: RRogers
Reviews.Content: I have had two experiences at the Santa Maria in Key West and both have been fabulous. The first being more of an adult only trip, the second with my extended family. The Santa Maria was perfect for both experiences. The Santa Maria is in a great location, close enough to all the action, but not buried in it. When it's time to relax, the tranquil pool area was perfect! The suites are modern, well equiped and miticulously cleaned. The kitchen is complete with all the dishes and gadgets you would have at home.. and more. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. Staying at the Santa Maria was a vacation unto itself.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Key West”
Reviews.Author: lsilver2002
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria Suites was an absolute gem. I traveled with 9 other girlfriends and we booked 2 of the 2bd/2 1/2 bath suites. The suites were amazing with plenty of room for all of us. They looked like Ikea showrooms with very modern appliances and amenities. The shower in the master room had two shower heads and was very luxurious. Wolfgang was very helpful when we checked in. The pool area was beautiful with complimentary smoothies during the day and complimentary wine and cheese in the afternoon. The staff was always amazing and I felt like they really wanted to help us, not that they were helping us just because they worked there. Lindsay booked a sunset cruise for our group that was spectacular. The pool area is open all night and we loved being able to take a late night dip after hitting Duval street. Wolfgang was always very helpful and brought us water and towels. I thought Santa Maria Suites was in a great location. It is one block over from Duval St but at the opposite end from where all the bars are. It was a short walk to the bars and it was very quiet at night. We just had such a great time and would absolutely stay at Santa Maria Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria Suites - Best in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: keeptrucking
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Key West at the end of May with my husband and a single friend of ours so needed two separate bedrooms - and what a lovely suite we stayed in. The first suite Ken put us in was partially overlooking the pool area, so we asked to move to a full pool view and it was no trouble at all. Both the suite we moved from and the one we moved to were immaculate, and we are VERY FUSSY travellers when it comes to accommodation. Santa Maria lived up to all the previous reviews and we couldn't fault it one bit. Upstairs suites not suitable for people with walking difficulties or very heavy suitcases though but the downstairs suites with patio were marvellous too. We are fit,active late 50's/early 60's who like drinking and eating and a modicum of nightlife, but want the added peace and quiet of a retreat at the end of the day - and believe me - this is it. We were able to walk to Duvall Street and Mallory Square mainly, but as the weather was hot, hot, hot, we took an "eco" taxi down one night and the cost was $7 for the three of us, so $10 with a tip...........no problems getting around either way. This is the quiet end of Duvall and worth every penny of the upmarket rate. Within walking distance of Hemingway's House and the wonderful La Te Da bar and restaurant - check out Ralph the barman's Mojitos before heading off for dinner! Too bad we only found it on our last night (isn't it always the way) - plus a great piano bar across the road from La Te Da, which was bluesy/jazzy live music. Also - eat at Duffys - steak and seafood superb and not overpriced - again a couple of blocks down. No problems if self-catering is your thing as there is a largish supermarket a couple of blocks down (normal prices and large selection) and a convenience store (pricey for wine and beers though) across the street. Loved the whole experience - please don't change the style, upmarket feel, or quiet policies and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: redpoet
Reviews.Content: I had friends (includes my wife and four other women) staying two blocks away at the real southernmost house (not the one called the southernmost house). They stay there every year . This year they allowed me to come for my birthday and put me up at the Santa Maria. The place was great (would be better if you could see the sea, but that didn't matter much to me as I hung out at their place which is right on the water with a pool). The Santa Maria is clean, friendly, modern, well kept, etc. Just what everyone else says who has stayed there. I was in the upstairs suite which is itself two stories with bedrooms on the second floor (Note: you wouldn't want to stay in these upstairs suites if you have any accessibility issues). The suite overlooked the pool and a very pretty courtyard "lagoon." The suite was very quiet no matter what was going on outside. The Santa Maria is located one block from the quiet end of Duvall Street. I would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful placid oasis”
Reviews.Author: Newbery
Reviews.Content: I selected the Santa Maria Suites based on the glowing tripadvisor reviews I read here , and my family and I were not disappointed. We have stayed at numerous properties in Key West, including the Marquesa, The Reach, The Pier House and Casa Marina, but the Santa Maria offers the perfect blend of amenities, service and charm. My hard-to-impress, skeptical 20 year old daughter fell in love with the suite immediately, and she and her 16 year old sister enjoyed the privacy afforded them by their own room with widescreen t.v. and own bathroom. My wife and I also enjoyed our own privacy, but were delighted by the fact that we didn't need to spring for a separate hotel room for them in pricey Key West. The rooms were comfortable and fastidious, and the full sized and well equipped kitchen was a plus if I had actually ever intended to cook (yeah, right!) The pool area is lushly planted and serene and just the right size, and the free smoothies offered were a refreshing treat. For us, and those seeking a quieter location, the hotel's in a perfect spot removed from the noise and traffic of Duval Street's rowdier end, but access to the commotion and festivities is a short walk or ride away. Many very good restaurants (Ambrosia, Louie's Backyard, Camille's, etc.) are easily accessible, as is a small beach. The staff could not have been friendlier or more accessible, and offered good recommendations for restaurants. All in all, The Santa Maria helped make our recent family outing a perfect escape.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Kinnik
Reviews.Content: Got this on a good deal through Expedia. One of the best appointed places I've ever stayed in, with two good-sized bedrooms, two shower-rooms, a lounge/big kitchen area and a utility room. Excellent quality through-out. Fresh muffins, ice creams and bottled water every day plus washing detergent if you need it. The two pools are not big, but are big enough. There's a small gym and free wireless internet connection. Its located at the quiet end of Key West, so you're not going to be in the thick of the action, but you can walk to the main touristy areas in about 15-20 minutes. The concierge service is extremely helpful and can advise on most things. Parking is free. Simply put, Santa Maria Suites is brilliant: if we return to Key West we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: mmh189
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have pretty much covered it! And we agree--this place is beautiful and peaceful, the rooms are clean and modern and contain just about anything you could want. We loved the balcony, as well as the courtyard and spent many mornings just relaxing by the pool with a book. The staff members were always incredibly friendly and helpful when we asked for anything, but they were also unobtrusive, allowing guests their privacy. One really nice "extra" that the hotel provided (they were available at the juice bar outside) was a coupon for a free bottle of wine at Camile's--a really delicious seafood restaurant nearby. We were happy to take advantage of that and had a really great dinner there. Another nice thing about the hotel is the full kitchen. While we didn't really cook, we did make a run to Fausto's and got some cheese, crackers, fruit and other goodies for lunches and snacks. So between that and the muffins and snacks provided by the hotel, we only ate out one meal per day, which was great for saving money. The wine chiller was a really nice touch, too! Some reviews have mentioned the location of the hotel as a minus, but we didn't find it to be an issue at all. We enjoyed walking down Duval street every night, and then returning to the quiet of the Santa Maria. Definitely bring comfortable shoes, but if you're in decent shape, the walking shouldn't be an issue. If I had any criticisms at all, I did notice that our room was showing just a few signs of wear and tear (a smudge on the curtain, scuff marks on the door, etc.), but that's inevitable for any hotel. I just hope that the hotel personnel makes upkeep a priority as more people discover the place. But from the wonderful level of service, I have confidence that they will. We had a wonderful honeymoon here and hope to return--maybe for our first anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!”
Reviews.Author: tmsdjs
Reviews.Content: We drove the long drive down to Key West from SC. We were exhausted when we arrived and when we entered our 2nd floor suite, all the frustration from the long drive just vanished. The suite was so nice and clean. It was really more than we expected. We have traveled many places in the US and Europe and I must say, Santa Maria Suites is at the top of my "nice places we have stayed" list. If you have the opportunity to book a suite here, book it!

Reviews.Title: “A Stress free haven!!!”
Reviews.Author: JudithSheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Exactly like the web site photos, the cleanliness and staff were brilliant. At the southernmost end of Key West but we enjoyed the walk down Duval Street nearly everyday. Free muffins, smoothies, dove ice bars, cheese, crackers, and wine everyday by the pool you need a walk to burn off the calories! We were in Key West for our son's wedding and the Santa Maria added to a truly memorable experience. We will definitely go back one day. 5 stars from all of us!!! THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: eadien7
Reviews.Content: Santa Maria is a wonderful hotel, I won't repeat all the amenities, but no big complaints. It is very quiet and secluded, you don't notice that you are in the middle of town. Seems that they set things up for 3. Three stools in the kitchen, three muffins (although more were provided upon request). Also, as another review stated, the 4 cup coffee maker. I had read the reviews and we purchased a larger coffee pot upon arrival in KW. Passing it on to another group in the morning when we leave. Maybe it will end up being the traveling coffee pot of Santa Maria. Patios in the upper floor villas are small, only two chairs. I would request a lower floor which seem to have more patio space. Be prepared for steps. The villas are on the second and third floors. No real hotel amenities, but a wonderfully quiet hotel. The pool was very quiet and relaxing after a day out in the hustle and bustle of KW. The rooms are sound proofed. Great for couples traveling together.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to high expectations”
Reviews.Author: love2travellove2eat
Reviews.Content: Stayed in pool view suite - 2 couples & we all raved about the place. Spotless & incredibly well equipped, staff without exception welcoming & friendly, nothing too much trouble. Free smoothies by pool plus wine & cheese from 16.00; mini choc-ices (dove), water & coffee in room; with muffins delivered in evening when beds turned down (with chocs). Everything best quality from toiletries to bed linen/towels and no shortage of pool towels. Although only one block off Duval, it's right at Atlantic end, great for breeze & beaches, but long walk in heat from Mallory & catamaran dock - get a taxi! Must do: sunset, Hemingway House (with guide), electric cars - fun, eay to drive & easier than walking in heat! But above all Azur restaurant. Once again Trip Advisor comments right on the money!

Reviews.Title: “Can Do Service & Beautiful Setting Made it the Perfect Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: ncgirls8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the private and peaceful Santa Maria with friends recently. Fabulous service in every way-there wasn't a request too large for their friendly and efficient staff--and we had many requests. The pool is surrounded by the suites and folliage and creates a wonderful sanctuary, plus complimentary drinks and appetizers in the afternoon. A very comfortable and friendly spa-like experience and I would reccommend it highly. Ashley - Greensboro, North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Would go again.”
Reviews.Author: jimsGreenville_SC
Reviews.Content: Two couples shared a two bedroom/two bath suite from April 28-May 1, 2009. More than met our expectations. One block off Duval, beautiful pool/courtyard views from each condo. Personal touches abound, from turndown with chocolates, delicious muffins delivered daily for breakfast, pool service with free frozen drinks, wine and cheese by the pool, very helpful staff, and I could go on! Santa Maria Suites deserves the #1 TripAdvisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: amanda1969
Reviews.Content: I am such a avid user of Tripadvisor. Since 2004, I have not traveled anywhere, or stayed in any hotel, without reading all the Tripadvisor reviews. When I saw that Santa Maria Suites had the number one rating and such great reviews, I had high expectation. was there from April 12-17, 2009, with my mother and two children (age 10 and 11). My expectations were exceeded. Let me start with the few flaws. Since you are a block away from the ocean, there are no ocean view rooms. The fitness room consists of a treadmill and some weights. Finally, if you are looking to be near the "action" side of Duval Street...well, the Santa Maria is on the opposite end. Personally, I was happy about that, but just know that before booking. Now, with that being said, there was so much that you will love, that the few minor points I just brought up won't matter. What sets this place apart is the unbelievable customer service. From the very beginning when I booked and spoke to Wolfgang, I knew this was a great place. He was so patient and helpful, and even gave me a poolview room at the same price as the garden view. When we arrived, Lindsay greeted us, and made us feel right at home. We had a problem with our room (the fridge didn't work), so we had to be moved the next day. Tatiana took care of moving all of our stuff, including the food. The room itself is huge and beautiiful. Granite surface, modern European appliances, and bathroom fixtures. There are two huge bedrooms and baths, with the most comfortable beds. The place has not one, but three huge flatscreen TVs. The room opens to the most beautifully landscaped pool. The pool itself is small, but it is very pretty and relaxing. The complimentary smoothies and nightly wine and cheese, is a great touch. Finally, the maid service is outstanding. This was the cleanest place I have ever stayed in. How could it be Florida, and I didn't see a single bug, not even a gnat, the entire week I was there. Finally, a word about Key West. My second time there. Simply, the best place in Florida. There is something for everyone. Casual, fun, laid back, great resturants, great music, beautiful beaches. My kiids had a fantastc time, nd my mom and I did as well. What else can you ask for? Key West is not a "scene" like South Beach. It s more like a way of life. Do go, and do not miss the Santa Mariia Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Halo2
Reviews.Content: This review came a little late but I would like to commend Santa Maria for a great stay when I was there last November with my family and my in-laws. We booked 2 suites and both suites were very clean. The kitchen equipment were all new and modern. Most importantly the suites came with washing machine and dryer which were very convenient as we didn't need to carry loads of dirty linen to those common laundrette like other hotels. The hotel also came with free parking, and there's a grocery store just across the road. My only complain was that my suite was located on the 2nd level and there wasn't any elevator. My husband and I had to carry suitcases each weighing more than 15kgs up the staircase. My sis-in-law however had a suite on the ground level and that was much more convenient. If I have a chance to return to KeyWest, I will not hesitate to staying there again. cheers

Reviews.Title: “Clothing "Optional" - Stolen or Discarded by Staff”
Reviews.Author: dinosaur123
Reviews.Content: My friends and I treated ourselves to a weekend at this hotel to get away although we live in the area. Personal clothing was left on balcony at check out to dry. Contacted hotel same day and was advised that no personal effects were found in room. Returned to hotel following day and was advise same story. For the price of hotel, it is terrible that several articles of clothing were stolen by staff or thrown out same day of check out. Guard your personals if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria Suites Rock!”
Reviews.Author: barbauba
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so beautiful. One of the best I have ever seen. Beds were very comfortable, showers were awesome. Kitchen was well stocked with everything you would need. Our room was kept so clean! Muffins, chocolates, and ice cream bars every day. The pool had a great atmosphere, and the smoothies were very refreshing. We traveled with another couple, so this was a perfect place to stay. I only had a few issues: (1) I was told on Friday 4/17, there is no more access to the Casa Marina, so disappointed (2) Towels were not restocked every day. They took the dirty ones, but did not leave clean ones. (3) Encountered an ignorant guest trying to save chairs at the pool, for which no one ever showed up to use the chairs! (4) The hotel is located at the opposite end of all the action, so be prepared to walk about 20 minutes each way.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want perfect accommodations, personable staff and a great pool then go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: BigSkyFamilyfun09
Reviews.Content: I spent alot of time researching where to stay in Key West for the week of Apr. 7th - 14th. We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary with our 2 teenagers and looking for a place that accommodated all of us. This was a great week and most of the guests were families just like us. It was sooooo comfortable! Their beds are awesome and my son appreciated the chocolate that was provided every nite for the turndown service. The kitchen was beautiful, the showers are fantastic (2 heads) and the 3 flat screens gave everyone some options. We stayed on the main level so both bedrooms had king size beds and we could just walk out to the pool - it was perfect!! The pools were like bath water which surprisingly was refreshing even in the middle of the day. You are located on the south end which we enjoyed and it was so handy to have a convenience store right across the street where you could get your coffee for the morning. The rental for bikes was also across the street and it was a 10 min. bike ride to Mallory for the sunset celebrations. The access to the Casa Marina was nice for the beach/fitness and you did not have to pay the $20. resort fee (I have always found those fees annoying!). It was a perfect place for us to do some celebrating! They have earned and deserve their 2009 Traveler's Choice Award!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but go outside of spring break weeks”
Reviews.Author: parks23
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. The rooms are amazing and the pool area is great. The location is a bit out of the way but has it's own perks nearby. Just beware of going during spring break. During our first night, some groups started to arrive. You heard them outside using the pool at 3 AM, which wasn't a big deal. You should expect that during break. The next day though, a very large group of rooms that all knew each other checked in. The pool looked like MTV as the previous commenter mentioned. Cups and bottles everywhere, both pools filled with people, music playing, and people throwing football from the glass balconies. All the seniors and families were shut out that we saw the day before. Managment did eventually come out and yell at the group, posted the rules on all the doors (including room capacity rules and quiet hours), and things were much better after that. I give them a lot of credit for that. Still, I was awakened during the middle of the night from doors as people went from room to room. Some front desk people on duty didn't seem to care much, while some did. We expressed our concerns more than once. For the price, we thought we would be safe from spring breakers. They have more money than we thought! I would still highly recommend this place, but go in Jan or Feb instead for your winter getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: theripper1977
Reviews.Content: Have you ever walked into a hotel room and your jaw dropped? You will if you stay at Santa Maria Suites. I stayed for two nights with my wife and some friends and we all loved the place. The staff was all fabulous, even going so far as to give us a discount after we had already checked out. It was spring break when we where there and we could not hear the crazy college kids through the walls at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip hotel with amazing beds!”
Reviews.Author: JenandDennis
Reviews.Content: The Santa Maria Suites are absolutely gorgeous. There are 32 suites surrounding a very nice courtyard with a great pool. We had a two story suite that had a living room, kitchen and bath on the first floor and two bedrooms and full baths on the second floor. Everything is done to the "nines" with a very hip sense of style. This hotel is down on the quiet side of the islnad which can be a good or bad thing depending on what you are looking for. It is about a mile walk to Mallory Square. We used the beach facilities at the Casa Marina which is beautiful. We really enjoyed our stay. Staff was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Gary_and_family
Reviews.Content: We arrived 17th March, flew into Fort Lauderdale and drove down to the Keys. Looks like we missed the Spring Breakers by a day or two, my daugther was bummed out about that. Everything was great from the first step into the registration right up until the point we had to leave. Enough can't be said of all of the staff, from the front office to the housekeeping and maintenance crew, they were all great. We spent a lot of time around the pool, more than I thought we would, our daughter 17 (sun bathed) and son 10 (found twin brother and sister the similar age) didn't seem to have a problem with it. While lounging and sipping on a strawberry slushie (we added coconut rum) Steph was more than willing to book a Jet Ski ride around the island for us. We did venture to Casa Marina a couple of times, we liked the beach at The Reach, even though we weren't supposed to have access there no one seemed to be concerned while they offered a towel or a chair. A person could go on but if you look at the majority of the posts they all basically say the same thing.......it's well worth the trip. Try it! If you stayed in unit 11 after we did I hope you found the wine in the fridge

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: big55
Reviews.Content: This place lives up to the hype. The room was better than expected. Staff is uber friendly. Free smoothies at the pool. Sushi was best I have had in a long time. Mini market across the street. Washer and Dryer was a huge help. Cucan deli with awesome coffee across the street. I can't say enough good things about the Santa Maria.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RedSoxRule44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria Suites during spring break in March. We found the resort to be located in an excellent location in Key West, adjacent to the Reach Resort. We were within walking distance to Duvall Street, the Southernmost Point and many other attractions. The service at the resort was top notch. The pool was very nice. The accomodations were condominium style with a great kitchen. We totally enjoyed our stay and would recommend this resort to any traveler going to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break at Santa Maria suites”
Reviews.Author: marthnan
Reviews.Content: Like the previous two reviews, we arrived on Friday March13 and our two daughters, 21 and 24 arrived on the 14th. Upon arrival our suite was spotless. and everything worked. We were surprised to see surprised to see the spring breakers at this type of hotel,However, most all of them checked out on Saturday. We too had issues a couple of days with late and very rushed housekeeping. The staff seemed to be was overwhelmed cleaning up after the spring breakers had left.We solved that problem by informing the front desk know when we left for the day and asked them to clean our rooms. We, too, called about the towel shortages. Apparantly their supplier did not make a complete delivery for a couple of days so everyone had fewer towels . We were in a deluxe first floor pool view suite. We enjoyed sitting on our terrace every afternoon. Once inside our suite we could hear very little from outside. Our bedrooms faced South Street, but the car noise did not bother us. We had wonderful weather so we sat by the Santa Maria pool a couple of days but the water was too warm for me . We spent most of our time at the Casa Marina ,with it's 2 big pools and huge beach area with lots of chairs. Steve and Scott were wonderful about setting up our chairs everyday. To be able to use the Casa Marina is a great benefit of staying at the Santa Maria. It is about a five minute walk to the Casa Marina. ( No need to take any towels, the Casa Marina provides them) We walked everywhere except to the major grocery stores. There is a quick market that has some supplies and sandwiches a cross the street. We found lots of restaurants to be within a 10 minute walk. Lots of restaurants in historic Key West are expensive, but are excellent. We loved Ambrosia, the sushi restaurant at the Santa Maria Suites.The servings are huge. Louie's Backyard is around the corner, which has wonderful out door seating. There is an Italian restaurant and Camille's, a seafood restaurant, less than a 5 minute walk. To walk to the other end of Duval is about a 20-30 minute stroll. Lots to look at! (Good and bad depending on your prospective!) There is so much to do and we did not have enough time! We would absolutely stay at the Santa Maria Suites again. I hope the management has learned from this year's spring break experience. The problems that they had this year did not spoil our vacation fun.

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says...just a few issues”
Reviews.Author: strfdtravllr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maris suites last week. We arrived on Friday the 13th and walked into EXACTLY what the previous reviewer describes- spring break gone wild. There were dozens of beer cans, empty plastic cups, tequila bottles and drunken, cursing frat boys littering the pool. We walked through the gorgeous pool area upon arrival and, after months of anticipation, were devastated to see that the hotel seemed to be catering to spring breakers. We considered leaving and were going to move to the Marquesa, but they have a no children policy and our 9 year old was with us. We promptly complained and the front desk agent seemed completely unable to help us. We mentioned posting pictures of the pool area on TripAdvisor and the agent immediately went out and started collecting the garbage. He called the manager, who did contact us the next day. By that time, the problem was solved, so we did not need to follow up- but it was good to know we could have. The previously mentioned paper of rules was also presented to us on check in- listing many rules-almost all of which were being broken! And we, mature adults with a child in tow, were asked to sign this agreement! After complaining, we were on our way back to our room, and one of the girls in the party of young people said...don't worry, you won't have to listen to us much longer, we all leave tomorrow. We were SO relieved...and don't understand why the front desk couldn't have set us at ease by mentioning that? The front desk agent told me the next day that 20 of the hotels 32 rooms checked out, and they were mostly the same group. 20 rooms, 4 to 6 people per room....you can imagine how many spring breakers there were!!!! It did seem like the hotel had been completely overwhelmed and they were trying to accommodate everyone as best as possible. Once the big group left, the hotel was peaceful and serene and very family oriented- like we expected. The only other so-so thing was housekeeping. Our unit seemed to be the last to be cleaned everyday. We would be out from morning till late afternoon, which always seemed like the time they wanted to clean the room (like, after 4). It was frustrating to be out all day and as soon as we wanted to come back to the room the cleaners arrived. Also, towels were not replaced daily, and we ran out a few times. Room was SPOTLESS on arrival. On to the good parts..the room is absolutely, terrifically gorgeous. The service, even on the first day, was kind and as helpful as they could be, given the circumstances- especially Ken. Every subsequent exchange was helpful and professional, and they really tried to go above and beyond. Location was good, a bit away from the action, which was good for us as we were wanting a relaxing holiday. Not too many restaurants nearby. Cuban takeout window across the street was good. Grounds are so beautiful and tropical, balconies great. We went on and on about the room...the space, the bathrooms (stunning- double shower in the master bath), the well-equipped kitchen- to everyone in Key West. The pool is as warm as bathwater and the free smoothies are awesome- our daughter must have had 5 a day! The pool concierge was a lovely service, and they were both very nice. The complimentary muffins (delicious) and dove ice cream bars were great...we looked forward to them everyday. Free high speed internet, free parking were appreciated. We are still talking about the bed- most comfortable bed in a hotel room EVER. Once the initial kinks were worked out, our stay was perfect. We're sorry it began the way it did. The hotel is deserving of its' great rating and the partying was out of place in the beautiful property. We would absolutely stay there again, in fact, we hope to again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances can be deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan1959
Reviews.Content: I was excited to finally make it to Key West and for the rate, I was a little taken back by the appearance of the Santa Maria, but I guess that was the moral of the trip, appearances can be deceiving. The outside is anything but impressive, but once you walk in the lobby it's quite nice. You can look out to the pool area which looks like you'd expect for their high rates. I want to make this clear, we had little issue with the hotel itself. The rooms were clean and nice, the pool area was pretty decent, when it wasn't over-run with Spring Breakers. That was my first complaint, for what we paid AND when I had asked months before because I knew we were coming in during Spring Break, the girl over the phone told me explicitly that they wouldn't be a place Spring Breakers would stay and it shouldn't be an issue. What a crock! It looked like MTV was outside our room the whole time. We couldn't use the pool at all because of all the kids. I don't even think half of them were staying there. And anytime we'd go to say something to a staff member, they were too busy to talk to us. It got really frustrating. When I did get to talk to a staff member, they were either really short with me or just flat out rude. I asked for a scooter rental and about a sunset sail, and the girl at the front desk called to the back office and asked "Who pays the most commission?" Obviously not even caring about the quality of the trip or vehicle, but how she could make the most off of us. Needless to say, I was so appalled that we booked with one of the street vendors. I was very disappointed with our stay, and to top it all off, when I was woken up several times through the night, when I finally asked the kids to be quiet at the pool, since it was well past midnight, I got told "The Manager said we could party!" While I doubt this claim, I went to talk to the manager about it before we left, I was told "She was too busy to talk to us." Not caring we were leaving. Overall, for the type of money they are asking, I'd stay somewhere else. The hotel is nice, but the staff is rude and greedy.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews are right - this IS a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spinntx
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 4 nights at the Santa Maria Suites and have to say the reviews don't exaggerate - the hotel, staff, and location are great. A couple of notes about things I did not see other reviewers comment on: 1) if you decide to rent bikes, just let the hotel staff know and theyâ€™ll arrange for them to be dropped off at the hotel for you so you donâ€™t need to worry with finding a place and returning them by a certain time, and 2) in addition to being able to access the beach at the â€œsisterâ€� hotel down the road, as a guest of the Santa Maria Suites you can access the beach adjacent to the Reach hotel that is right next door â€“ great sunrises over the water!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Suz00
Reviews.Content: We chose the Santa Maria Suites based on the great reviews here and we were not disappointed. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bath townhome facing the pool. The room was spotless and had modern decor, fully equiped kitchen, washer & dryer, flat screen tvs and free breakfast muffins, ice cream bars and smoothies at the pool and free parking. The staff was knowledgable and friendly. We visited the complimentary sister property, the Casa Marina, which was a fantastic surprise. It had 2 huge pools, a private beach with hammocks, games and water sports. The service was excellent. The Santa Maria Suites is on the quiet end of Duval, but only a 10 minute walk to the action. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: 3fromMN
Reviews.Content: You must stay at the Santa Maria Suites! We already knew it was going to be a great place just by reading reviews. It was amazing. The staff is extremely helpful and everyone there is so nice. We stayed with another couple in one of the 2 Queen room suites. The rooms were a bit smaller than expected, but you're just sleeping there! The bathrooms were very nice, as well as the kitchen and living room/seating area. You're only 2 blocks from Duval....but can take a quick cab ride to the North end of the island and walk around. We had a rental car that we used to drive down to the keys, but really didn't need it while there (except for going to the beach). The parking lot at Santa Maria was generous and we never had to worry about not having a parking spot. The pool and pool deck was a great place to spend the day laying out....nice quiet environment, warm pool. We would Definetely stay there again, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: lynpf
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night. This hotel was everything and more than advertised. The suite we had was 2 floors (#21). Kitchen, living room, 1/2 bath and washer dryer on first floor. Two bedrooms with queen beds ( be careful not to bump your shins on the platform bed frame) and full bathrooms on second floor. We arrived late, yet the staff was waiting and happy to get us settled (Ken even walked us to our room and showed us around)! The room was probably the cleanest I have ever encountered. Every need was anticipated by the staff as the suite was fully equipped. They provide you with laundry detergent, every pot and pan you can imagine, and all of the kitchen tools to fix and serve an entire meal. Most every room looks out over the pools and gardens, which are beautifully maintained. Our room had 3 patios so the doors were often left open late into the night for the warm tropical breezes. The furnishings are VERY contemporary, which thrilled my 16 year old daughter to no end. Both bedrooms were almost identical, so if traveling with 2 couples there wouldn't be that "who gets the better room" issue. The granite, Jenn Air and Cuisinart kitchen was fun to work in, and easy to maintain (dishwasher, wine cooler, perfect organization of dishes, glasses, etc by the staff). Closets are large and will easily handle all of your clothing and luggage (we traveled with our 2 teenage daughters who bring SO much, yet had plenty of storage space). My only complaint, and believe me this one is minor, is that the room was perfectly stocked on arrival.....plenty of towels (unlike any other hotel in this world) , Key lime cookies, bottled water, coffee, tea, and dove ice cream bars in the kitchen, and those wonderful Bath and Body Works ammenties in the bathroom. The restocking of these items was not consistant. We had to leave a note to ask for more tea bags, and had to call for towels (the used ones were removed, but no new ones were delieverd). Hand towels were removed from the kitchen and 1st floor bathroom, yet none were brought back. Those great key lime cookies were never seen again after the first night, nor was the bottled water replenished. The Bath and BodyWorks products (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc) were replaced some nights, but not all....one night leaving my daughters without any shampoo. I know these are minor complaints and they were quickly fixed when a call was made to the front desk. I guess this is a complaint I have the world over. Hotels seem to woo you the first night with totally stocked units, yet on following nights, the service seems to slack a bit. We are paying the same price every single night, is it too much to ask that the room is maintained the same way each niight? Don't get me wrong, this hotel is a treasure and the staff is top notch. After reading the great reviews, I was a bit nervous that the real thing wouldn't measure up, but it was really amazing. Words can't describe the feeling of being totally pampered and relaxed that you will have while here. Be sure to take the quick bike ride or walk over to Casa Marina Hotel. Santa Maria has beach use rights there and it is WONDERFUL. The staff there treated us as if we were staying there, even though they knew we were guests at Santa Maria. The ocean front beach, pools, staff and landscaping made a wonderful spot to relax a few hours every afternoon. Lunch pool side was delicious. I was always happy to return to Santa Maria though, as the Casa Marina was VERY large and the Santa Maria really has that "Oasis" feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: London2900
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Santa Maria Suites and enjoyed our family vacation very much. The rooms are perfect for families with children, with two bathrooms, large bedrooms and a full kitchen area. The pool area is great for young kids, with warm water and shallow depths. The free smoothiees by the pool are a nice touch which the kids definately taking advantage of this. The rooms are of high quality and everything is in good (new) condition with very little wear and tear - but this is what you pay for as well! Although the resort deserves an excellent rating it is not perfect, with resorts right by the water obviously having a better location. It is also worth noting that some rooms are better located than others. Although the nicest rooms are on the sunny side of the resort, the bedrooms face towards South Street which is often noisy during the evening and night. Something to be aware of if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expexted”
Reviews.Author: goincomfort
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place. Great location, friendly staff, Marvellous rooms

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria is Gold”
Reviews.Author: BSchram
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Santa Maria with a group of close friends and everyone had a phenomenal experience. From the luxurious rooms to the extremely helpful concierge, the Santa Maria exceeded all expectations. The Santa Maria will be the one and only choice upon return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Santa Maria Suites”
Reviews.Author: cmcp610
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this hotel is....GREATTTTTTTT. Just read all the other reviews....as they are spot on.

Reviews.Title: “It really is as good as people say!”
Reviews.Author: Trinitraveler13
Reviews.Content: We saw the number #1 rating on tripadvisor.com and thought this probably is too good to be true. Or that the #1 rating had prompted too many visitors and that the place became over-popular and lost some of its charm. or the prices skyrocketed. None of this is true. The place was perfect. Set on the more serene side of the Key (opposite from the high trafficed--but must see--Mallory Park) it has a wonderful location just 1/2 block from the beach. It is a low rise that surrounds a heated pool that is open 24 hours and has a small a fun arc fountain. The rooms are great. I do not like to overblow reviews and have expectations raised too high but I'll simply say without reservation that you'll love it. Granite counter-tops; two bedrooms; washer & dryer and plenty of space. Go. You won't be disappopinted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Doogerdog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Maria from 12/25-30 and loved it. There was 15 in our group (4 rooms). We had a 2nd/3rd floor 2 bedroom condo. The rooms were very nice (modern decor) and well maintained. The front staff was very helpful providing advice on things to do and places to eat (and directions/reservations). We ate most breakfasts in (and 1 dinner) so having a well equipped kitchen with top of the line appliances was appreciated. Every night the staff gives you muffins and mini dove ice cream bars which was an added bonus. By the pool, there were complimentary smoothies (booze optional and free). We have 2 teen age boys (19 and 16). The second bedroom with 1 king size bed was an inconvenience. However, the boys rotated sleeping on the living room couch and they didn't mind. Our living room and bed room balcony overlooked the pool so we got nice warm breezes from across the courtyard. My sister had a side room so her balcony faced the side of our complex and the parking lot (be sure to ask for a pool view). The hotel location is at the south end of Duval Street so you are away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to the action (1.5 miles from Mallory square for the sunset ritual). The sister hotel is the Casa Marina and is about 3-4 blocks away located on the beach. You can use all of their facilities (health club, pool and beach). All-in-all a wonderful place to stay -- we will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: LyleK
Reviews.Content: This is THE place for a family or 2 couples traveling together to stay in Key West. Just a block off Duval, you get the convenience without the traffic or all night revelry noise. You also get: - The friendliest and most helpful staff imaginable - Great, new, comfortable rooms with full kitchen and washer/dryer - Free coffee, muffins, Dove ice cream bars, cool drinks by the pool - Turn down service with chocolates on the pillows - Did I mention the helpful and friendly staff that will gladly help with dinner or activity arrangements? Stay here....

Reviews.Title: “Santa Maria review”
Reviews.Author: kikid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Santa Maria Resort from December 26th thru the 29th. We have a family of four so needed two rooms. Unfortunately the rooms have king beds. Not good when you have two teenage boys not wanting to share the same bed. They put an air mattress on the floor in the living room but it was cumbersome. Overall the resort is very nice. If you absolutely need a full kitchen and washer/dryer then this is the place for you! If you are like me and want cool ocean breezes coming in the window at night and don't want to cook while on vacation...then don't stay here! Our room was stuffy at night (had to use the a/c everynight) with parked cars outside our window. Positive side: free drinks and snacks all day by the pool!! While the resort and staff were nice there are much better accommodations in Key West with a more tropical feel, right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Casper65
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort - friendly and helpful staff, huge suites for family of four with 2 bedrooms with King size beds, modern and fully equipped kitchenette, 3 huge TVs, great ambience, easy access to carpark (& free parking too!), washer & dryer provided, etc ..... Highly recommended for families. Do opt for the ground floor units which are larger than the ones on the upper floors ... although they may be slightly more expensive, but it's worth it...

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Santa Maria”
Reviews.Author: larrypharm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights December 5-8. The pictures and descriptions on the web site hardly did it justice. Room and staff were wonderful. Only complaint being that one day our room did not get cleaned. The gentleman at the desk apologized profusely and came up immediatly to deliver towels and take the trash. Kitchen seemed ready to go (although the oven was quite small). But did not go on vacation to cook. Key West itself seemed to really be down (perhaps it was just the time of the year). It seemed really odd to be in mostly empty bars. The last night we were there (a Monday night) only 7 of the units were occupied

HotelInfo.Name: Santa Maria Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1401 Simonton Street, Key West, FL 33040
